1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

2.text: Take the sum of all the assembly of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, every male, head by head.

3.text: From twenty years old and upward, all who are able to go forth for military service in Israel, you and Aaron shall number them by their companies.

4.text: And with you there shall be a man from every tribe, each man the head of his fathers'; household.

5.text: And these are the names of the men who shall stand with you. From Reuben: Elizur the son of Shedeur.

6.text: From Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

7.text: From Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

8.text: From Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar.

9.text: From Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon.

10.text: From the children of Joseph: from Ephraim: Elishama the son of Ammihud; from Manasseh: Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

11.text: From Benjamin: Abidan the son of Gideoni.

12.text: From Dan: Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

13.text: From Asher: Pagiel the son of Ochran.

14.text: From Gad: Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

15.text: From Naphtali: Ahira the son of Enan.

16.text: These are the ones who were called from the assembly, the leaders of the tribes of their fathers; they were the heads of the thousands of Israel.

17.text: And Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name.

18.text: And on the first day of the second month they gathered all the assembly together; and they registered themselves by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, head by head.

19.text: As Jehovah commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.

20.text: And the children of Reuben, Israel';s firstborn, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

21.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Reuben: forty-six thousand five hundred.

22.text: From the children of Simeon, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, those who were numbered of them, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

23.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Simeon: fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

24.text: From the children of Gad, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

25.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Gad: forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.

26.text: From the children of Judah, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

27.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Judah: seventy-four thousand six hundred.

28.text: From the children of Issachar, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

29.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Issachar: fifty-four thousand four hundred.

30.text: From the children of Zebulun, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

31.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Zebulun: fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

32.text: From the children of Joseph: from the children of Ephraim, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

33.text: Those who were numbered of them, from the tribe of Ephraim: forty thousand five hundred.

34.text: And from the children of Manasseh, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

35.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Manasseh: thirty-two thousand two hundred.

36.text: From the children of Benjamin, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

37.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Benjamin: thirty-five thousand four hundred.

38.text: From the children of Dan, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

39.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Dan: sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

40.text: From the children of Asher, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

41.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Asher: forty-one thousand five hundred.

42.text: From the children of Naphtali, their generations, by their families, by their fathers'; households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service,

43.text: Those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Naphtali: fifty-three thousand four hundred.

44.text: These were the ones who were numbered, whom Moses and Aaron numbered, with the leaders of Israel, twelve men, each one for his fathers'; household.

45.text: So all who were numbered of the children of Israel by their fathers'; households, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth for military service in Israel,

46.text: Even all the numbered men were six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.

47.text: But the Levites were not numbered among them by their fathers'; tribe.

48.text: For Jehovah had spoken to Moses, saying,

49.text: Only the tribe of Levi you shall not number, nor shall you take the sum of them among the children of Israel;

50.text: But you, appoint the Levites over the Tabernacle of the Testimony and over all its furnishings and over all that belongs to it. They shall carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; and they shall minister to it and shall encamp around the tabernacle.

51.text: And when the tabernacle sets out, the Levites shall take it down; and when the tabernacle encamps, the Levites shall set it up. But the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

52.text: And the children of Israel shall encamp, each one by his own camp and each one by his own standard, according to their companies.

53.text: But the Levites shall encamp around the Tabernacle of the Testimony, that there be no wrath upon the assembly of the children of Israel. And the Levites shall keep the charge of the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

54.text: Thus did the children of Israel do; according to all that Jehovah had commanded Moses, so they did.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

2.text: The children of Israel shall encamp each by his own standard with the ensigns of their fathers'; households; they shall encamp facing the Tent of Meeting on every side.

3.text: And those who encamp on the east side toward the sunrise shall be of the standard of the camp of Judah, according to their companies; and the leader of the children of Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab;

4.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: seventy-four thousand six hundred.

5.text: And those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar; and the leader of the children of Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar;

6.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: fifty-four thousand four hundred.

7.text: Then the tribe of Zebulun; and the leader of the children of Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon;

8.text: And his company, that is, his numbered men: fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

9.text: All who were numbered of the camp of Judah: one hundred eighty-six thousand four hundred, according to their companies. They shall set out first.

10.text: On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their companies; and the leader of the children of Reuben: Elizur the son of Shedeur;

11.text: And his company, that is, his numbered men: forty-six thousand five hundred.

12.text: And those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon; and the leader of the children of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;

13.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

14.text: Then the tribe of Gad; and the leader of the children of Gad: Eliasaph the son of Reuel;

15.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.

16.text: All who were numbered of the camp of Reuben: one hundred fifty-one thousand four hundred fifty, according to their companies. And they shall set out second.

17.text: Then the Tent of Meeting shall set out, with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps; as they encamp, so shall they set out, every man in his place, by their standards.

18.text: On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their companies; and the leader of the children of Ephraim: Elishama the son of Ammihud;

19.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: forty thousand five hundred.

20.text: And next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh; and the leader of the children of Manasseh: Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;

21.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: thirty-two thousand two hundred.

22.text: Then the tribe of Benjamin; and the leader of the children of Benjamin: Abidan the son of Gideoni;

23.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: thirty-five thousand four hundred.

24.text: All who were numbered of the camp of Ephraim: one hundred eight thousand one hundred, according to their companies. And they shall set out third.

25.text: On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan according to their companies; and the leader of the children of Dan: Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;

26.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

27.text: And those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher; and the leader of the children of Asher: Pagiel the son of Ochran;

28.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: forty-one thousand five hundred.

29.text: Then the tribe of Naphtali; and the leader of the children of Naphtali: Ahira the son of Enan;

30.text: And his company, that is, those who were numbered of them: fifty-three thousand four hundred.

31.text: All who were numbered of the camp of Dan: one hundred fifty-seven thousand six hundred. They shall set out last by their standards.

32.text: These are those who were numbered of the children of Israel by their fathers'; households. All who were numbered in the camps according to their companies were six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.

33.text: But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel, as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

34.text: Thus did the children of Israel do. According to all that Jehovah commanded Moses, so they encamped by their standards and so they set out, every one by their families, according to their fathers'; households.

1.text: Now these are the generations of Aaron and Moses at the time when Jehovah spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.

2.text: And these are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar;

3.text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, who were consecrated to serve as priests.

4.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before Jehovah when they offered strange fire before Jehovah in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the presence of Aaron their father.

5.text: And Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

6.text: Bring the tribe of Levi near and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him.

7.text: And they shall keep his charge and the charge of the whole assembly before the Tent of Meeting to do the service of the tabernacle.

8.text: And they shall keep all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting and the charge of the children of Israel to do the service of the tabernacle.

9.text: And you shall give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons; they are wholly given to him from among the children of Israel.

10.text: And you shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall keep their priesthood; but the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

11.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

12.text: As for Me, I have now taken the Levites from among the children of Israel instead of every firstborn who opens the womb among the children of Israel. So the Levites shall be Mine.

13.text: For all the firstborn are Mine; on the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified to Myself all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast. They shall be Mine; I am Jehovah.

14.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,

15.text: Number the children of Levi by their fathers'; households, by their families; every male from a month old and upward you shall number.

16.text: And Moses numbered them according to the word of Jehovah, as he was commanded.

17.text: And these were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon and Kohath and Merari.

18.text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon according to their families: Libni and Shimei.

19.text: And the sons of Kohath by their families: Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

20.text: And the sons of Merari according to their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers'; households.

21.text: Of Gershon were the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimeites; these are the families of the Gershonites.

22.text: Those who were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, even those who were numbered of them were seven thousand five hundred.

23.text: The families of the Gershonites shall encamp behind the tabernacle on the west.

24.text: And the leader of the father';s household of the Gershonites shall be Eliasaph the son of Lael.

25.text: And the charge of the sons of Gershon in the Tent of Meeting shall be the tabernacle and the tent, its covering and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

26.text: And the hangings of the court, and the screen for the entrance of the court, which is around the tabernacle and around the altar, and its cords for all its service.

27.text: And of Kohath were the family of the Amramites and the family of the Izharites and the family of the Hebronites and the family of the Uzzielites; these are the families of the Kohathites.

28.text: According to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, there were eight thousand six hundred, keeping the charge of the sanctuary.

29.text: The families of the sons of Kohath shall encamp on the side of the tabernacle to the south.

30.text: And the leader of the father';s household of the families of the Kohathites shall be Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.

31.text: And their charge shall be the Ark and the table and the lampstand and the altars and the utensils of the sanctuary with which they minister and the screen and all its service.

32.text: And Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be leader of the leaders of the Levites and have the oversight of those who keep the charge of the sanctuary.

33.text: Of Merari were the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites; these are the families of Merari.

34.text: And those who were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward: six thousand two hundred.

35.text: And the leader of the father';s household of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. They shall encamp on the side of the tabernacle to the north.

36.text: And the appointed charge of the sons of Merari shall be the boards of the tabernacle and its bars and its pillars and its sockets and all its equipment and all the service pertaining to it,

37.text: And the pillars around the court and their sockets and their pegs and their cords.

38.text: And those who encamp before the tabernacle to the east, before the Tent of Meeting toward the sunrise, shall be Moses and Aaron and his sons, keeping the charge of the sanctuary for the charge of the children of Israel; and the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

39.text: All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of Jehovah, by their families, all the males from a month old and upward were twenty-two thousand.

40.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, Number all the firstborn males of the children of Israel from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.

41.text: And you shall take the Levites for Me -- I am Jehovah -- instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the cattle of the children of Israel.

42.text: And Moses numbered, just as Jehovah commanded him, all the firstborn among the children of Israel.

43.text: And all the firstborn males according to the number of names, from a month old and upward, of those who were numbered of them were twenty-two thousand two hundred seventy-three.

44.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

45.text: Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of their cattle; and the Levites shall be Mine; I am Jehovah.

46.text: And for the redemption of the two hundred seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel over and above the number of the Levites,

47.text: You shall take five shekels apiece per head; according to the shekel of the sanctuary you shall take them. (The shekel is twenty gerahs.)

48.text: And you shall give the money, by which the excess number of them is redeemed, to Aaron and to his sons.

49.text: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were over and above those who were redeemed by the Levites;

50.text: From the firstborn of the children of Israel he took the money, a thousand three hundred sixty-five shekels according to the shekel of the sanctuary.

51.text: And Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and to his sons, according to the word of Jehovah, as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

2.text: Take the sum of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their families, by their fathers'; households,

3.text: From thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, all who enter into the service to perform the skilled work in the Tent of Meeting.

4.text: This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting concerning the most holy things.

5.text: When the camp sets out, Aaron and his sons shall go in, and they shall take down the veil of the screen and cover the Ark of the Testimony with it,

6.text: And they shall put on it a covering of porpoise skin, and shall spread over it a cloth all of blue strands, and shall put in its poles.

7.text: And over the table of the bread of the Presence they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the plates and the cups and the bowls and the pitchers of the drink offering; and the continual bread shall be on it.

8.text: And they shall spread over them a scarlet cloth, and cover it with a covering of porpoise skin, and shall put in its poles.

9.text: And they shall take a blue cloth, and cover the lampstand of the light and its lamps and its tongs and its firepans and all its oil vessels with which they minister to it.

10.text: And they shall put it and all its utensils within a covering of porpoise skin, and shall put it on the carrying frame.

11.text: And over the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth, and cover it with a covering of porpoise skin, and shall put in its poles.

12.text: And they shall take all the utensils of ministry with which they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a blue cloth, and cover them with a covering of porpoise skin, and shall put them on the carrying frame.

13.text: And they shall remove the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth over it.

14.text: And they shall put upon it all its utensils with which they minister at it, the firepans, the forks, and the shovels, and the basins -- all the utensils of the altar; and they shall spread over it a covering of porpoise skin, and put in its poles.

15.text: And when Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, whenever the camp sets out, then the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them; but they shall not touch the holy things, or they will die. These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting.

16.text: And the oversight of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be the oil for the light and the fragrant incense and the continual meal offering and the anointing oil, the oversight of all the tabernacle and all that is in it, the sanctuary and its furnishings.

17.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

18.text: Do not let the tribe of the families of the Kohathites be cut off from among the Levites;

19.text: But do this to them that they may live and not die when they approach the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and assign each one of them to his service and to his burden;

20.text: But the Kohathites shall not go in to see the sanctuary even for a moment; otherwise they will die.

21.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

22.text: Take the sum of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers'; households, by their families;

23.text: From thirty years old and upward to fifty years old you shall number them, everyone who enters to carry out the service to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

24.text: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens:

25.text: They shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle, and the Tent of Meeting, its covering, and the covering of porpoise skin that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

26.text: And the hangings of the court, and the screen for the entrance of the gate of the court, which is around the tabernacle and around the altar, and their cords, and all the equipment for their service; and whatever is to be done with them, so shall they do.

27.text: All the service of the sons of the Gershonites shall be at the command of Aaron and his sons, in all their burden and in all their service; and you shall assign to them the charge of all they are to carry.

28.text: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting, and their charge shall be under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

29.text: As for the sons of Merari, you shall number them by their families, by their fathers'; households;

30.text: From thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old you shall number them, everyone who enters into the service to do the work of the Tent of Meeting.

31.text: And this is the charge of what they are to carry, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting: the boards of the tabernacle and its bars and its pillars and its sockets,

32.text: And the pillars around the court and their sockets and their pegs and their cords, with all their equipment and with all their service; and you shall assign by name the equipment they have been charged to carry.

33.text: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

34.text: And Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the assembly numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families and by their fathers'; households,

35.text: From thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting.

36.text: And those who were numbered of them by their families were two thousand seven hundred fifty.

37.text: These are those who were numbered of the families of the Kohathites, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of Jehovah through Moses.

38.text: And those who were numbered of the sons of Gershon by their families and by their fathers'; households,

39.text: From thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,

40.text: Even those who were numbered of them, by their families, by their fathers'; households were two thousand six hundred thirty.

41.text: These were those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Gershon, everyone who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of Jehovah.

42.text: And those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, by their families, by their fathers'; households,

43.text: From thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,

44.text: Even those who were numbered of them by their families were three thousand two hundred.

45.text: These were those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of Jehovah through Moses.

46.text: All those who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the leaders of Israel numbered, by their families and by their fathers'; households,

47.text: From thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered to do the work of service and the work of bearing burdens in the Tent of Meeting,

48.text: Even those who were numbered of them were eight thousand five hundred eighty.

49.text: According to the commandment of Jehovah through Moses they were numbered, everyone according to his service and according to his burden; thus they were numbered by him, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Command the children of Israel that they send out of the camp every leper and everyone that has a discharge and everyone who is unclean because of a dead person.

3.text: You shall send out both male and female; you shall send them outside the camp so that they will not defile their camp, where I dwell in their midst.

4.text: And the children of Israel did so and sent them outside the camp; just as Jehovah had spoken to Moses, so the children of Israel did.

5.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

6.text: Speak to the children of Israel, When a man or woman commits any sin that men commit, so as to act unfaithfully toward Jehovah, and that person realizes his guilt,

7.text: Then they shall confess their sin which they have committed, and he shall make restitution according to its principal for his wrong and add to it one-fifth of it and give it to the one whom he has wronged.

8.text: But if the man has no kinsman to whom restitution may be made for the wrong, the restitution which is made for the wrong goes to Jehovah for the priest, in addition to the ram of the expiation, by which expiation is made for him.

9.text: And every heave offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they present to the priest, shall be his.

10.text: And everyone';s holy things shall be his; whatever anyone gives to the priest, it becomes his.

11.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

12.text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, If any man';s wife goes astray and acts unfaithfully toward him,

13.text: And a man lies with her and has sexual relations, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband, and she is undetected, and she is defiled, and there is no witness against her since she was not caught in the act;

14.text: And a spirit of jealousy comes upon him, and he is jealous of his wife, and she has defiled herself; or if a spirit of jealousy comes upon him, and he is jealous of his wife, and she has not defiled herself;

15.text: Then the man shall bring his wife to the priest and bring her offering for her, a tenth of an ephah of barley meal. He shall pour no oil upon it nor put frankincense on it; for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of remembrance, bringing iniquity to remembrance.

16.text: And the priest shall bring her near and set her before Jehovah.

17.text: And the priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel, and the priest shall take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.

18.text: And the priest shall set the woman before Jehovah and let the hair of the woman';s head go loose and put the meal offering of remembrance in her hands, which is the meal offering of jealousy, and in the hand of the priest shall be the water of bitterness that brings the curse.

19.text: And the priest shall make her take an oath and shall say to the woman, If no man has lain with you and if you have not gone astray to uncleanness while under the authority of your husband, be immune to this water of bitterness that brings the curse.

20.text: But if you have gone astray while under the authority of your husband and if you have defiled yourself, and a man besides your husband has lain with you --

21.text: Then the priest shall make the woman take an oath with the oath of cursing, and the priest shall say to the woman -- Jehovah make you a curse and an oath among your people, when Jehovah makes your thigh waste away and your womb swell;

22.text: And this water that brings the curse shall go into your bowels and make your womb swell and your thigh waste away. And the woman shall say, Amen, Amen.

23.text: And the priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall wash them off into the water of bitterness.

24.text: And he shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that brings the curse; and the water that brings the curse shall enter into her and become bitter.

25.text: And the priest shall take the meal offering of jealousy out of the woman';s hand, and he shall wave the meal offering before Jehovah and bring it to the altar.

26.text: And the priest shall take a handful of the meal offering as its memorial portion and burn it upon the altar, and afterward he shall make the woman drink the water.

27.text: And when he has made her drink the water, then if she has defiled herself and has acted unfaithfully to her husband, the water that brings the curse will enter into her and become bitter, and her womb will swell, and her thigh will waste away; and the woman shall be a curse among her people.

28.text: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, then she will be immune and able to conceive seed.

29.text: This is the law of jealousy when a wife, while under the authority of her husband, goes astray and defiles herself,

30.text: Or when the spirit of jealousy comes upon a man, and he is jealous of his wife. He shall set the woman before Jehovah, and the priest shall apply to her all this law.

31.text: And the man shall be free from iniquity, but that woman shall bear her iniquity.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, When a man or a woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazarite, to separate himself to Jehovah,

3.text: He shall separate himself from wine and strong drink; he shall drink no vinegar of wine or vinegar of strong drink, nor shall he drink any juice of grapes, nor eat fresh or dried grapes.

4.text: All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is produced by the grape vine, from the seeds even to the skin.

5.text: All the days of his vow of separation no razor shall pass over his head. He shall be holy until the days are fulfilled for which he separated himself to Jehovah; he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long.

6.text: All the days that he separates himself to Jehovah he shall not come near a dead person.

7.text: He shall not make himself unclean for his father or for his mother, for his brother or for his sister, when they die, because his separation to God is upon his head.

8.text: All the days of his separation he is holy to Jehovah.

9.text: And if anyone dies very suddenly beside him so that he defiles the head of his separation, then he shall shave his head on the day he becomes clean; on the seventh day shall he shave it.

10.text: And on the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

11.text: And the priest shall offer one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, and make expiation for him because he sinned by reason of the dead person. And he shall sanctify his head that same day.

12.text: And he shall separate to Jehovah the days of his separation and shall bring a male lamb a year old for a trespass offering, but the former days shall be void because his separation was defiled.

13.text: Now this is the law of the Nazarite when the days of his separation are fulfilled: He shall be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

14.text: And he shall present his offering to Jehovah: one male lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering, and one female lamb a year old without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for a peace offering,

15.text: And a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and their meal offering and their drink offerings.

16.text: And the priest shall present them before Jehovah and offer his sin offering and his burnt offering.

17.text: And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to Jehovah, with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest shall also offer its meal offering and its drink offering.

18.text: And the Nazarite shall shave the head of his separation at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and take the hair of the head of his separation and put it on the fire that is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.

19.text: And the priest shall take the boiled shoulder of the ram and one unleavened cake out of the basket and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them into the hands of the Nazarite after he has shaved the head of his separation;

20.text: And the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before Jehovah. It is holy for the priest, together with the breast of the wave offering and thigh of the heave offering. And afterward the Nazarite may drink wine.

21.text: This is the law of the Nazarite who vows, that is, of his offering to Jehovah for his separation, in addition to what he can afford; according to his vow which he vows, so he must do according to the law of his separation.

23.text: Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, Thus you shall bless the children of Israel; you shall say to them,

24.text: Jehovah bless you and keep you;

25.text: Jehovah make His face shine upon you and be gracious to you;

26.text: Jehovah lift up His countenance upon you and give you peace.

27.text: So shall they put My name upon the children of Israel, that I Myself may bless them.

2.text: The leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers'; households (they were the leaders of the tribes, who were over those who had been numbered), presented their offering.

3.text: And they brought their offering before Jehovah: six covered wagons and twelve oxen, a wagon for every two of the leaders and an ox for each one; and they presented them before the tabernacle.

4.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

5.text: Take these from them that they may be used in doing the service of the Tent of Meeting; and you shall give them to the Levites, to each according to his service.

6.text: And Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and gave them to the Levites.

7.text: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon according to their service;

8.text: And four wagons and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

9.text: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because the service of the sanctuary belonged to them; they bore this upon their shoulder.

10.text: And the leaders presented offerings for the dedication of the altar in the day that it was anointed; that is, the leaders presented their offering before the altar.

11.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, They shall present their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar.

12.text: And he who presented his offering the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.

13.text: And his offering was one silver plate; its weight was one hundred thirty shekels; one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal offering;

88.text: And all the livestock for the sacrifice of peace offerings: twenty-four bulls, sixty rams, sixty male goats, sixty male lambs a year old. This was the dedication of the altar, after it was anointed.

89.text: And when Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with Him, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the expiation cover that was upon the Ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim; and he spoke to Him.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to Aaron and say to him, When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps will give light in front of the lampstand.

3.text: And Aaron did so; he set up its lamps to give light in front of the lampstand, as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

4.text: Now this was the workmanship of the lampstand, beaten work of gold; from its base to its flowers it was beaten work. According to the pattern which Jehovah had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.

5.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

6.text: Take the Levites from among the children of Israel and cleanse them.

7.text: And thus you shall do to them to cleanse them: Sprinkle the water of purification upon them, and let them pass a razor over all their flesh and wash their clothes and cleanse themselves.

8.text: Then let them take a bull of the herd and its meal offering, fine flour mingled with oil; and a second bull of the herd you shall take for a sin offering.

9.text: And you shall present the Levites before the Tent of Meeting and gather the whole assembly of the children of Israel.

10.text: And you shall present the Levites before Jehovah, and the children of Israel shall lay their hands upon the Levites.

11.text: And Aaron shall offer the Levites before Jehovah as a wave offering from the children of Israel, that they may do the service of Jehovah.

12.text: And the Levites shall lay their hands upon the heads of the bulls, and you shall offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to Jehovah to make expiation for the Levites.

13.text: And you shall set the Levites before Aaron and before his sons, and offer them as a wave offering to Jehovah.

14.text: Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the children of Israel, and the Levites shall be Mine.

15.text: Then after this the Levites may go in to do the service of the Tent of Meeting. So you shall cleanse them and offer them as a wave offering.

16.text: For they are wholly given to Me from among the children of Israel; I have taken them for Myself instead of everyone who opens the womb, the firstborn of all the children of Israel.

17.text: For all the firstborn among the children of Israel are Mine, both human and animal. On the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified them for Myself.

18.text: And I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel.

19.text: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the Tent of Meeting, and to make expiation for the children of Israel, that there may be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come near to the sanctuary.

20.text: Thus did Moses and Aaron and the whole assembly of the children of Israel do to the Levites; according to all that Jehovah had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did the children of Israel do to them.

21.text: And the Levites purified themselves from sin and washed their clothes. Then Aaron offered them as a wave offering before Jehovah, and Aaron made expiation for them to cleanse them.

22.text: And after this the Levites went in to do their service in the Tent of Meeting before Aaron and before his sons; as Jehovah had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.

23.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

24.text: This is what applies to the Levites: From twenty-five years old and upward they shall go in to perform the service in the work of the Tent of Meeting.

25.text: And from the age of fifty years they shall retire from the service in the work and shall serve no more.

26.text: But they may minister to their brothers in the Tent of Meeting, to keep the charge, but they themselves shall do no service. Thus you shall do with the Levites concerning their charges.

1.text: Now Jehovah had spoken to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

2.text: Let the children of Israel keep the passover at its appointed time.

3.text: On the fourteenth day of this month at twilight, you shall keep it at its appointed time; according to all its statutes and according to all its ordinances you shall keep it.

4.text: Thus Moses told the children of Israel to keep the passover.

5.text: And they kept the passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai; according to all that Jehovah commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did.

6.text: But there were certain men who were unclean through contact with a dead person, so that they could not keep the passover on that day; so they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day.

7.text: And those men said to him, Although we are unclean through contact with a dead person, why must we be kept from presenting the offering of Jehovah at its appointed time among the children of Israel?

8.text: And Moses said to them, Stay here so I may hear what Jehovah will command concerning you.

9.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

10.text: Speak to the children of Israel, saying, Any one of you or your descendants who becomes unclean through contact with a dead person or is on a distant journey shall still keep the passover to Jehovah.

11.text: In the second month on the fourteenth day at twilight they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

12.text: They shall not leave any of it until the morning, nor break a bone of it; according to every statute of the passover they shall keep it.

13.text: But the man who is clean and is not on a journey yet refrains from keeping the passover, that person shall be cut off from his people, because he did not present Jehovah';s offering at its appointed time; that man shall bear his sin.

14.text: And if a stranger sojourns with you and keeps the passover to Jehovah; according to the statute of the passover and according to its ordinance, so shall he do. You shall have one statute, both for the sojourner and for the native born in the land.

15.text: And on the day that the tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the tabernacle, the Tent of the Testimony; and in the evening it was like the appearance of fire over the tabernacle until morning.

16.text: So it was always; the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

17.text: And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tent, then after that the children of Israel set out; and in the place where the cloud settled, there the children of Israel encamped.

18.text: At the commandment of Jehovah the children of Israel set out, and at the commandment of Jehovah they encamped; as long as the cloud settled upon the tabernacle, they remained encamped.

19.text: Even when the cloud extended its time over the tabernacle for many days, the children of Israel kept the charge of Jehovah and did not set out.

20.text: If sometimes the cloud was upon the tabernacle a few days, according to the commandment of Jehovah they remained encamped; then at the commandment of Jehovah they set out.

21.text: If sometimes the cloud remained from evening until morning, when the cloud was taken up in the morning, they set out; or if it remained a day and a night, when the cloud was taken up, they set out.

22.text: Whether it was two days or a month or a longer time that the cloud extended its time over the tabernacle and settled above it, the children of Israel remained encamped and did not set out; but when it was taken up, they set out.

23.text: At the commandment of Jehovah they encamped, and at the commandment of Jehovah they set out. They kept the charge of Jehovah according to the commandment of Jehovah through Moses.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Make yourself two trumpets of silver; of beaten work you shall make them; and you shall use them for summoning the assembly and for the setting out of the camps.

3.text: And when they blow them, all the assembly shall gather themselves to you at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

4.text: But if they blow only one, then the leaders, the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall gather themselves to you.

5.text: And when you blow an alarm, the camps that are encamped on the east side shall set out.

6.text: And when you blow an alarm the second time, the camps that are encamped on the south side shall set out. They shall blow an alarm for them to set out.

7.text: But when the congregation is to be gathered together, you shall blow, but you shall not sound an alarm.

8.text: And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets; and this shall be for you a perpetual statute throughout your generations.

9.text: And when you go to war in your land against the adversary who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets, so that you may be remembered before Jehovah your God and be saved from your enemies.

10.text: Also on your days of rejoicing and at your appointed feasts and at the beginnings of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; and they shall be a reminder on your behalf before your God; I am Jehovah your God.

11.text: Now it was in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, that the cloud was taken up from over the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

12.text: And the children of Israel set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. Then the cloud settled down in the wilderness of Paran.

13.text: And they set out for the first time according to the commandment of Jehovah through Moses.

14.text: And the standard of the camp of the children of Judah set out first according to their companies; and over the entire company was Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

15.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Issachar was Nethanel the son of Zuar.

16.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.

17.text: And the tabernacle was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who carried the tabernacle, set out.

18.text: And the standard of the camp of Reuben set out according to their companies; and over the entire company was Elizur the son of Shedeur.

19.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

20.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Gad was Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

21.text: And the Kohathites, who carried the holy things, set out; and the tabernacle was set up before their arrival.

22.text: And the standard of the camp of the children of Ephraim set out according to their companies; and over the entire company was Elishama the son of Ammihud.

23.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Manasseh was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

24.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Benjamin was Abidan the son of Gideoni.

25.text: And the standard of the camp of the children of Dan, which was the rear guard of all the camps, set out according to their companies; and over the entire company was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

26.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Asher was Pagiel the son of Ochran.

27.text: And over the company of the tribe of the children of Naphtali was Ahira the son of Enan.

28.text: This was the order in which the children of Israel set out according to their companies, when they set out.

29.text: And Moses said to Hobab the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses'; father-in-law, We are setting out to the place concerning which Jehovah said, I will give it to you. Come with us, and we will treat you well, for Jehovah has promised good to Israel.

30.text: But he said to him, I will not go; but rather I will go to my own land and to my relatives.

31.text: So Moses said, Please do not leave us, for you know where we can encamp in the wilderness, and you will be eyes for us.

32.text: And if you go with us, whatever good Jehovah does for us, we will do for you.

33.text: So they set out from the mountain of Jehovah three days'; journey, with the Ark of the Covenant of Jehovah setting out before them three days'; journey, to seek out a resting place for them.

34.text: And the cloud of Jehovah was over them by day when they set out from the camp.

35.text: And when the Ark set out, Moses said, Rise up, O Jehovah, and let Your enemies be scattered; / And let those who hate You flee before You.

36.text: And when it came to rest, he said, Return, O Jehovah, to the ten thousand thousands of Israel.

1.text: And the people became like those who murmur about their misfortune in the ears of Jehovah; and when Jehovah heard it, His anger was kindled, and the fire of Jehovah burned among them and consumed some at the outskirts of the camp.

2.text: And the people cried to Moses; and Moses prayed to Jehovah, and the fire abated.

3.text: And the name of that place was called Taberah because the fire of Jehovah had burned among them.

4.text: And the mixed multitude that was among them lusted exceedingly; and the children of Israel also wept again and said, Who shall give us meat to eat?

5.text: We remember the fish which we used to eat in Egypt for nothing, the cucumbers and the melons and the leeks and the onions and the garlic;

6.text: But now our appetite has gone; there is nothing at all but this manna to look at.

7.text: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its appearance like the appearance of bdellium.

8.text: The people went about and gathered it and ground it between two millstones or beat it in a mortar; then they boiled it in pots and made cakes of it; and its taste was like the taste of cakes baked in oil.

9.text: And when the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall with it.

10.text: And Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, each at the entrance of his tent; and the anger of Jehovah was kindled greatly, and Moses was displeased.

11.text: And Moses said to Jehovah, Why have You treated Your servant badly, and why have I not found favor in Your sight, that You have put the burden of all this people upon me?

12.text: Did I conceive all this people? Or did I bring them forth, so that You should say to me, Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries the nursing child, to the land which You swore to give to their fathers?

13.text: From where should I get meat to give to all this people? For they weep before me, saying, Give us meat, so that we may eat!

14.text: I am not able to bear all this people alone, for it is too heavy for me.

15.text: And if this is the way You deal with me, please kill me at once -- if I have found favor in Your sight -- and do not let me see my wretchedness.

16.text: So Jehovah said to Moses, Gather to Me seventy, each one from the elders of Israel, whom you know are the elders of the people and their officers, and bring them to the Tent of Meeting, and have them stand there with you.

17.text: Then I will come down and talk with you there, and I will take of the Spirit who is upon you and will put Him upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, so that you do not bear it alone.

18.text: And you shall say to the people, Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat; for you have wept in the ears of Jehovah, saying, Who will give us meat to eat? For it was well with us in Egypt. Therefore Jehovah will give you meat, and you shall eat.

19.text: You shall eat not one day, nor two days, nor five days, nor ten days, nor twenty days,

20.text: But a whole month, until it comes out from your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you, because you have rejected Jehovah who is among you and have wept before Him, saying, Why did we ever come out of Egypt?

21.text: But Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand on foot; and You have said, I will give them meat so that they may eat a whole month.

22.text: Will flocks and herds be slain for them, to satisfy them? Or will all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to satisfy them?

23.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, Has Jehovah';s hand become short? Now you will see whether My word will come to pass for you or not.

24.text: So Moses went out and told the people the words of Jehovah, and he gathered seventy, each one from the elders of the people, and set them around the tent.

25.text: And Jehovah came down in the cloud and spoke to him, and He took of the Spirit who was upon him and put Him upon the seventy elders. And when the Spirit rested upon them, they prophesied, but they did not do so again.

26.text: But two men had remained in the camp, the name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad. And the Spirit rested upon them. (Now they were among those who were registered, but they had not gone out to the tent.) And they prophesied in the camp.

27.text: And a certain young man ran and told Moses and said, Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.

28.text: And Joshua the son of Nun, the attendant of Moses, one of his chosen men, answered and said, My lord Moses, restrain them!

29.text: But Moses said to him, Are you jealous for my sake? Oh that all Jehovah';s people were prophets, that Jehovah would put His Spirit upon them!

30.text: And Moses returned to the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

31.text: And a wind went forth from Jehovah and brought quails from the sea and let them fall beside the camp, about a day';s journey on this side and a day';s journey on the other side, all around the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the earth.

32.text: And the people rose up all that day and all the night and all the next day, and they gathered the quail. He who gathered least gathered ten homers. And they spread them out for themselves all around the camp.

33.text: While the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the anger of Jehovah was kindled against the people, and Jehovah struck the people with a very severe plague.

34.text: And the name of that place was called Kibroth-hattaavah because there they buried the people who lusted.

35.text: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people journeyed to Hazeroth, and they remained at Hazeroth.

1.text: And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married (for he had married a Cushite woman).

2.text: And they said, Has Jehovah indeed spoken only through Moses? Has He not also spoken through us? And Jehovah heard it.

3.text: Now the man Moses was very meek, more than anyone else who was on the face of the earth.

4.text: And suddenly Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron and to Miriam, You three come out to the Tent of Meeting. So the three of them came out.

5.text: Then Jehovah came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the tent, and called Aaron and Miriam. And when they had both come forward,

6.text: He said, Hear now My words: If there is a prophet among you, / I, Jehovah, will make Myself known to him in a vision; / I will speak with him in a dream.

7.text: My servant Moses is not so; / He is faithful in all My house.

8.text: With him I speak face to face, even openly, and not in riddles;And he beholds the form of Jehovah.  Why then were you not afraid to speak against My servant, against Moses?

9.text: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against them, and He departed.

10.text: And when the cloud had departed from over the tent; there Miriam was, leprous, as white as snow. And Aaron turned toward Miriam, and there she was, leprous.

11.text: And Aaron said to Moses, Oh, my lord, please do not lay this sin upon us that we have so foolishly committed.

12.text: Please do not let her be like one dead, whose flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother';s womb.

13.text: And Moses cried to Jehovah, saying, Please heal her, O God, please.

14.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, If her father had just spat in her face, would she not bear her shame seven days? Let her be shut up outside the camp seven days, and after that she may be brought in again.

15.text: So Miriam was shut up outside the camp seven days, and the people did not set out until Miriam had been brought in again.

16.text: After that the people set out from Hazeroth and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Send men to spy out the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel; one man from each of their fathers'; tribes you shall send, every one a leader among them.

3.text: So Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran according to the commandment of Jehovah, all of them leading men among the children of Israel.

4.text: And these were their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur;

5.text: From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori;

6.text: From the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh;

7.text: From the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph;

8.text: From the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun;

9.text: From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu;

10.text: From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi;

11.text: From the tribe of Joseph, that is, from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi;

12.text: From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli;

13.text: From the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael;

14.text: From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi;

15.text: From the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.

16.text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land. And Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun Joshua.

17.text: And when Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, he said to them, Go up this way into the Negev, and go up into the hill country;

18.text: And see what the land is like; and whether the people who live in it are strong or weak, whether they are few or many;

19.text: And whether the land in which they dwell is good or bad; and whether the cities that they live in are like camps or with fortifications;

20.text: And whether the land is fat or lean; whether there are trees in it or not. Therefore strengthen yourselves and bring some of the fruit of the land. Now the time was the time of the first ripe grapes.

21.text: So they went up and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, near the entrance of Hamath.

22.text: And when they had gone up through the Negev, they came to Hebron; and Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, were there. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

23.text: Then they came to the Valley of Eshcol, and from there they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes; and they carried it on a pole between two of them. They also cut off some of the pomegranates and some of the figs.

24.text: That place was called the Valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the children of Israel cut down from there.

25.text: And they returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days.

26.text: And they proceeded to come to Moses and to Aaron and to the whole assembly of the children of Israel, to the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh; and they brought back word to them and to the whole assembly, and showed them the fruit of the land.

27.text: And they told him and said, We came to the land into which you sent us; and it indeed flows with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.

28.text: However, the people who dwell in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large; and we also saw the descendants of Anak there.

29.text: The Amalekites dwell in the land of the Negev, and the Hittites and the Jebusites and the Amorites dwell in the hill country, and the Canaanites dwell by the sea and along the Jordan.

30.text: But Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, Let us go up at once and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it.

31.text: But the men who went up with him said, We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we.

32.text: And they brought to the children of Israel an evil report of the land which they had spied out, saying, The land, through which we have gone to spy it out, is a land that eats up its inhabitants; and all the people that we saw in it are men of great size.

33.text: And there we saw the Nephilim (the descendants of Anak are part of the Nephilim); and we were like grasshoppers in our own sight, and so we were in their sight.

1.text: Then the whole assembly lifted up their voice and cried, and the people wept that night.

2.text: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron; and the whole assembly said to them, If only we had died in the land of Egypt! Or if only we had died in this wilderness!

3.text: And why does Jehovah bring us into this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will become plunder. Would it not be better for us to return to Egypt?

4.text: And they said one to another, Let us appoint a captain, and let us return to Egypt.

5.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before the whole congregation of the assembly of the children of Israel.

6.text: And Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, who were among those who spied out the land, tore their clothes.

7.text: And they spoke to the whole assembly of the children of Israel, saying, The land through which we passed to spy out is an exceedingly good land.

8.text: If Jehovah is pleased with us, He will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land which flows with milk and honey.

9.text: Only do not rebel against Jehovah, nor should you fear the people of the land, for they are our bread. Their protection has been removed from them, and Jehovah is with us; do not fear them.

10.text: But the whole assembly said to stone them with stones. Then the glory of Jehovah appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the children of Israel.

11.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, How long will this people despise Me? And how long will they not believe in Me, in spite of all the signs that I have done among them?

12.text: I will strike them with pestilence and dispossess them, and I will make of you a nation greater and mightier than they.

13.text: But Moses said to Jehovah, Then the Egyptians will hear of it, for by Your might You brought this people up from their midst,

14.text: And they will tell the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that You, Jehovah, are in the midst of this people; for You, O Jehovah, are seen in plain sight, and Your cloud stands over them, and You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.

15.text: Now if You put this people to death as one man, then the nations that have heard the report about You will speak, saying,

16.text: Because Jehovah was not able to bring this people into the land which He swore to give them, He has therefore slaughtered them in the wilderness.

17.text: And now, I pray, let the power of the Lord be great, just as You have spoken, saying,

18.text: Jehovah is slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness, forgiving iniquity and transgression; but He will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and the fourth generations.

19.text: Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of Your lovingkindness, just as You have forgiven this people from Egypt even until now.

20.text: Then Jehovah said, I have pardoned them according to your word;

21.text: But as surely as I live, and as all the earth will be filled with the glory of Jehovah,

22.text: None of those men who have seen My glory and My signs, which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have tried Me these ten times and have not listened to My voice,

23.text: Shall see the land which I swore to give to their fathers, nor shall any of those who despised Me see it.

24.text: Only My servant Caleb, because he had a different spirit and has fully followed Me, will I bring into the land which he entered; and his descendants shall take possession of it.

25.text: Now since the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwell in the valleys, turn tomorrow, and set out into the wilderness by the way that leads to the Red Sea.

26.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

27.text: How long shall I bear with this evil assembly, which murmurs against Me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they are making against Me.

28.text: Say to them, As I live, declares Jehovah, just as you have spoken in My ears, so will I do to you.

29.text: Your corpses shall fall in this wilderness, and none of you who were numbered, according to the number you counted from twenty years old and upward, who have murmured against Me,

30.text: Shall come into the land, in which I swore to settle you, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.

31.text: But your little ones, whom you said would become plunder, I will bring in, and they will know the land which you have rejected.

32.text: But as for you, your corpses shall fall in this wilderness.

33.text: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and they shall suffer for your unfaithfulness until your corpses have been consumed in the wilderness.

34.text: According to the number of the days which you spied out the land, forty days, a year for every day, you shall bear your iniquities, forty years; and you shall know My displeasure.

35.text: I, Jehovah, have spoken; surely I will do this to all this evil assembly who are gathered together against Me. In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.

36.text: And the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land, who returned and made the whole assembly to murmur against him by bringing up an evil report against the land,

37.text: That is, those men who brought up an evil report of the land, died by the plague before Jehovah.

38.text: Only Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive out of those men who went to spy out the land.

39.text: And when Moses spoke these words to all the children of Israel, the people mourned greatly.

40.text: And they rose up early in the morning to go up to the top of the mountain, saying, Here we are; now we will go up to the place which Jehovah has spoken of, for we have sinned.

41.text: But Moses said, Why do you again transgress the commandment of Jehovah? This will not succeed.

42.text: Do not go up -- for Jehovah is not among you -- so that you are not struck down before your enemies.

43.text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you shall fall by the sword. Because you have turned back from following Jehovah, therefore Jehovah will not be with you.

44.text: But they presumed to go up to the top of the mountain, even though neither the Ark of the Covenant of Jehovah nor Moses had departed out of the midst of the camp.

45.text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who dwelt in that hill country came down and struck them and beat them back as far as Hormah.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land that you are to inhabit, which I am giving you,

3.text: And you make an offering by fire to Jehovah, a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to make a special vow or as a freewill offering or at your appointed feasts, to make a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah, from the herd or from the flock,

4.text: The one who presents his offering shall present to Jehovah a meal offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mingled with a fourth of a hin of oil.

5.text: And you shall prepare wine for the drink offering, a fourth of a hin, with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.

6.text: Or for a ram you shall prepare as a meal offering two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mingled with a third of a hin of oil;

7.text: And for the drink offering you shall present a third of a hin of wine, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah.

8.text: And when you prepare a herd animal for a burnt offering or for a sacrifice, to make a special vow or for peace offerings to Jehovah,

9.text: Then you shall offer with the herd animal a meal offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mingled with half a hin of oil;

10.text: And you shall present for the drink offering half a hin of wine, an offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah.

11.text: Thus shall it be done for each ox or for each ram or for each of the male lambs or goats.

12.text: According to the number that you prepare, so you shall do for every one according to their number.

13.text: All who are native shall do these things in this way, in presenting an offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah.

14.text: And if a stranger sojourns with you, or one who may be among you throughout your generations, and he wants to make an offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah; just as you do, so he shall do.

15.text: For the congregation there shall be one statute for you and for the stranger who sojourns with you, a perpetual statute throughout your generations; as you are, so shall the sojourner be before Jehovah.

16.text: One law and one ordinance shall be for you and for the stranger who sojourns with you.

17.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

18.text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land into which I am bringing you,

19.text: Whenever you eat of the bread of the land, you shall offer up a heave offering to Jehovah.

20.text: From the first of your dough you shall offer up a cake for a heave offering; as the heave offering of the threshing floor, so shall you offer it up.

21.text: From the first of your dough you shall give to Jehovah a heave offering throughout your generations.

22.text: And if you sin unintentionally and do not observe all these commandments which Jehovah has spoken to Moses,

23.text: That is, everything that Jehovah has commanded you through Moses, from the day that Jehovah gave commandment and onward throughout your generations,

24.text: Then, if it was done unintentionally, without the knowledge of the assembly, the whole assembly shall offer one bull of the herd for a burnt offering, for a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah, with its meal offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering.

25.text: And the priest shall make expiation for the whole assembly of the children of Israel, and they shall be forgiven; for it was unintentional, and they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to Jehovah, and their sin offering before Jehovah for their error.

26.text: And the whole assembly of the children of Israel shall be forgiven, and the stranger who sojourns among them; for all the people were involved unintentionally.

27.text: And if one person sins unintentionally, then he shall present a female goat a year old for a sin offering.

28.text: And the priest shall make expiation before Jehovah for the person who sinned unintentionally, when he sins unintentionally, to make expiation for him; and he shall be forgiven.

29.text: You shall have one law for the one who does anything unintentionally, for one who is a native among the children of Israel and for the stranger who sojourns among them.

30.text: But the person who does anything with a high hand, whether a native or a sojourner, that one reviles Jehovah; and that person shall be cut off from among his people.

31.text: Because he has despised the word of Jehovah and has broken His commandment, that person shall be completely cut off; his iniquity shall be upon him.

32.text: Now while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.

33.text: And those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron and to the whole assembly.

34.text: And they put him in custody, because it had not been declared what should be done to him.

35.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, The man shall surely be put to death; the whole assembly shall stone him with stones outside the camp.

36.text: So the whole assembly brought him outside the camp and stoned him to death with stones, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

37.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

38.text: Speak to the children of Israel and tell them to make for themselves fringes on the borders of their garments throughout their generations and to put on the fringe of each border a cord of blue.

39.text: And it shall be a fringe for you, so that when you see it you will remember all the commandments of Jehovah and do them, so that you do not seek after your own heart and your own eyes, according to which you committed fornication;

40.text: That you shall remember and do all My commandments and be holy to your God.

41.text: I am Jehovah your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God; I am Jehovah your God.

1.text: Now Korah the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, the sons of Reuben, took men

2.text: And rose up before Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred fifty leaders of the assembly, who were summoned to the meeting, well-known men.

3.text: And they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said to them, You take too much upon yourselves, for all the assembly are holy, every one of them, and Jehovah is among them. Why then do you exalt yourselves above the congregation of Jehovah?

4.text: And when Moses heard this, he fell on his face.

5.text: And he spoke to Korah and to all his company, saying, In the morning Jehovah will make known who is His and who is holy, and will bring him near to Himself; even the one whom He will choose He will bring near to Himself.

6.text: Do this: Take censers for yourselves, Korah and all your company,

7.text: And put fire in them, and put incense on them before Jehovah tomorrow; and the man whom Jehovah chooses, he shall be holy. It is you who take too much upon yourselves, O sons of Levi!

8.text: And Moses said to Korah, Hear now, O sons of Levi:

9.text: Is it a small thing for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the assembly of Israel to bring you near to Himself to do the service of the tabernacle of Jehovah and to stand before the assembly to minister to them?

10.text: Or that He has brought you near, and all your brothers the sons of Levi with you? And do you seek the priesthood also?

11.text: Therefore you and all your company are gathered together against Jehovah; but Aaron, what is he that you murmur against him?

12.text: Then Moses sent word to call Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab; but they said, We will not come up!

13.text: Is it not enough that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, but must you also lord it over us?

14.text: Indeed, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor have you given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up!

15.text: Then Moses became very angry and said to Jehovah, Do not regard their offering. I have not taken a single donkey from them, nor have I done harm to any of them.

16.text: And Moses said to Korah, You and all your company be present before Jehovah, both you and they along with Aaron, tomorrow.

17.text: And let each of you take his censer and put incense on them, and each of you present his censer before Jehovah, two hundred fifty censers; you also and Aaron shall each present his censer.

18.text: So each took his censer and put fire in them and laid incense on them, and they stood at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting with Moses and Aaron.

19.text: Thus Korah gathered the whole assembly against them at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of Jehovah appeared to the whole assembly.

20.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

21.text: Separate yourselves from among this assembly, so that I may consume them in a moment.

22.text: But they fell on their faces and said, O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, will one man sin and You be angry with the whole assembly?

23.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

24.text: Speak to the assembly, saying, Get away from around the dwellings of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.

25.text: Then Moses rose up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.

26.text: And he spoke to the assembly, saying, Depart now from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing which belongs to them, or you will be swept away with all their sins.

27.text: So they got away from around the dwellings of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the entrance of their tents, with their wives and their children and their little ones.

28.text: And Moses said, By this you shall know that Jehovah has sent me to do all these works, for it is not of myself.

29.text: If these people die as all human beings die, or if what befalls all human beings befalls them, then Jehovah has not sent me.
