30.text: But if Jehovah brings about a new thing, and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they descend alive into Sheol, then you will understand that these men have despised Jehovah.

31.text: And as soon as he finished speaking all these words, the ground that was under them was split open.

32.text: So the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, along with their households and everyone who belonged to Korah and all their possessions.

33.text: So they and all that belonged to them descended alive into Sheol; and the earth closed over them, and they perished from the midst of the congregation.

34.text: And all Israel who were around them fled at their outcry, for they said, The earth may swallow us up too!

35.text: And fire came forth from Jehovah and consumed the two hundred fifty men who presented the incense.

36.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

37.text: Tell Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest to take the censers up out of the burning and scatter the fire about; for they are holy.

38.text: The censers of those who have sinned against their own lives, let them be made into beaten plates for a covering of the altar, for they presented them before Jehovah and they became holy. So they shall be a sign to the children of Israel.

39.text: And Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers which those who were burned had offered; and they beat them out as a covering of the altar,

40.text: As a reminder to the children of Israel that no stranger who is not of the seed of Aaron may come near to burn incense before Jehovah, so that he does not become like Korah and his company, just as Jehovah had spoken to him through Moses.

41.text: But on the next day the whole assembly of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, You have caused the people of Jehovah to die.

42.text: But when the assembly gathered against Moses and against Aaron, they looked toward the Tent of Meeting, and there the cloud was, covering it; and the glory of Jehovah appeared.

43.text: And Moses and Aaron came to the front of the Tent of Meeting.

44.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

45.text: Get away from the midst of this assembly that I might consume them in a moment. And they fell upon their faces.

46.text: And Moses said to Aaron, Take the censer and put fire in it from the altar, and lay incense on it, and carry it quickly to the assembly, and make expiation for them. For wrath has gone forth from Jehovah; the plague has begun.

47.text: And Aaron took it as Moses had said and ran into the midst of the assembly. And indeed the plague had begun among the people. So he put on the incense and made expiation for the people.

48.text: And he stood between the dead and the living, and the plague was stopped.

49.text: Now those who died by the plague were fourteen thousand seven hundred, besides those who died on account of Korah.

50.text: So Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting when the plague had been stopped.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and take from them rods, one for each father';s house, twelve rods from all their leaders according to their fathers'; houses; you shall write everyone';s name upon his rod.

3.text: And you shall write Aaron';s name upon the rod of Levi, for there shall be one rod for the head of each of their fathers'; houses.

4.text: And you shall place them in the Tent of Meeting before the Testimony, where I meet with you.

5.text: And the rod of the man whom I choose shall bud, and I will put a stop to the murmurings of the children of Israel against Me, which they murmur against you.

6.text: So Moses spoke to the children of Israel. And every one of their leaders gave him a rod, one rod for each leader according to their fathers'; houses, twelve rods, with the rod of Aaron among their rods.

7.text: And Moses placed the rods before Jehovah in the Tent of the Testimony.

8.text: And on the next day Moses went into the Tent of the Testimony, and there was the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi: it had budded; it even put forth buds and produced blossoms and bore ripe almonds.

9.text: And Moses brought out all the rods from before Jehovah to all the children of Israel, and they looked; and each one took his rod.

10.text: Then Jehovah said to Moses, Put back the rod of Aaron before the Testimony to be kept as a sign against the rebels, so that you may put an end to their murmurings against Me, and they not die.

11.text: And Moses did so; just as Jehovah commanded him, so he did.

12.text: And the children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, Alas, we die out; we perish; all of us perish.

13.text: Everyone who comes near, who comes near to the tabernacle of Jehovah, dies. Are we to completely die out?

1.text: Then Jehovah said to Aaron, You and your sons and your father';s household with you shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary; and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.

2.text: And your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, bring near with you, so that they may be joined to you and minister to you, while you and your sons with you are before the Tent of the Testimony.

3.text: And they shall keep your charge and the charge of all the tent, but they shall not come near to the furnishings of the sanctuary and to the altar, so that they do not die, neither they nor you.

4.text: And they shall be joined to you and keep the charge of the Tent of Meeting for all the service of the tent, but a stranger shall not come near to you.

5.text: And you shall keep the charge of the sanctuary and the charge of the altar, so that there may be no more wrath upon the children of Israel.

6.text: And I Myself have taken your brothers the Levites from among the children of Israel. They are a gift to you, given to Jehovah, to do the service of the Tent of Meeting.

7.text: But you and your sons with you shall attend to your priesthood for everything concerning the altar and within the veil, and you shall carry out your service. I give you the priesthood as a service of gift, but the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

8.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Aaron, And I Myself have given you charge of My heave offerings, even all the holy things of the children of Israel; I have given them to you because of the anointing, and to your sons, as a perpetual statute.

9.text: This shall be yours of the most holy things, kept from the fire. Every offering of theirs, even every meal offering of theirs and every sin offering of theirs and every trespass offering of theirs, which they shall render to Me, shall be most holy for you and for your sons.

10.text: As the most holy things you shall eat it; every male shall eat it; it shall be holy to you.

11.text: This also is yours, the heave offering of their gift, even all the wave offerings of the children of Israel. I have given them to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you, as a perpetual statute; everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.

12.text: All the best of the oil, and all the best of the new wine and of the grain, their firstfruits that they give to Jehovah, I have given to you.

13.text: The firstfruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to Jehovah, shall be yours; everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.

14.text: Everything devoted in Israel shall be yours.

15.text: Everything that opens the womb of all flesh, which they present to Jehovah, whether human or animal, shall be yours; nevertheless the firstborn of human beings you shall surely redeem, and the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.

16.text: And those who are to be redeemed from a month old you shall redeem, according to your estimation, for five shekels of silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.

17.text: But the firstborn of a cow or the firstborn of a sheep or the firstborn of a goat you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood upon the altar and burn their fat as an offering by fire for a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah.

18.text: But their flesh shall be yours; like the breast of the wave offering and like the right thigh, it shall be yours.

19.text: All the heave offerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel offer to Jehovah, I have given to you and to your sons and your daughters with you, as a perpetual statute. It is a covenant of salt forever before Jehovah for you and for your descendants with you.

20.text: And Jehovah said to Aaron, You shall have no inheritance in their land, nor shall you have any portion among them; I am your portion and your inheritance among the children of Israel.

21.text: And to the children of Levi I have now given every tithe in Israel for an inheritance in return for their service which they carry out, the service of the Tent of Meeting.

22.text: From now on the children of Israel shall not come near the Tent of Meeting, so that they do not incur sin and die.

23.text: But the Levites shall do the service of the Tent of Meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity; it shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations. And among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.

24.text: For the tithe of the children of Israel, which they offer as a heave offering to Jehovah, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance; therefore I have said to them, Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.

25.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

26.text: Moreover you shall speak to the Levites and say to them, When you take from the children of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them as your inheritance, then you shall offer up a heave offering from it for Jehovah, a tithe of the tithe.

27.text: And your heave offering shall be reckoned to you as though it were the grain of the threshing floor and the fullness of the wine press.

28.text: Thus you shall also offer a heave offering to Jehovah from all your tithes, which you receive from the children of Israel; and from it you shall give Jehovah';s heave offering to Aaron the priest.

29.text: Out of all your gifts you shall offer every heave offering of Jehovah, from all the best of it, the sanctified portion of it from them.

30.text: Therefore you shall say to them, When you heave from it the best of it, then it shall be reckoned to the Levites as though it were the produce of the threshing floor and the produce of the wine press.

31.text: And you may eat it in every place, you and your households, for it is your reward in return for your service in the Tent of Meeting.

32.text: And you shall bear no sin by reason of it, when you have heaved from it the best of it. But you shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, so that you do not die.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

2.text: This is the statute of the law which Jehovah has commanded, saying, Tell the children of Israel to bring you a red heifer without defect, in which is no blemish and upon which a yoke has never come.

3.text: And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest, and someone shall bring it outside the camp and slaughter it in his presence.

4.text: And Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle its blood toward the front of the Tent of Meeting seven times.

5.text: And the heifer shall be burned in his sight; its skin and its flesh and its blood, with its dung, shall be burned.

6.text: And the priest shall take cedar wood and hyssop and scarlet strands, and cast them into the midst of the burning of the heifer.

7.text: Then the priest shall wash his clothes and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp; but the priest shall be unclean until the evening.

8.text: And he who burns the heifer shall wash his clothes in water and bathe his body in water, and shall be unclean until the evening.

9.text: And a man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and place them outside the camp in a clean place, and it shall be kept for the assembly of the children of Israel as water for impurity; it is a sin offering.

10.text: And he who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening. And it shall be a perpetual statute to the children of Israel and to the stranger who sojourns among them.

11.text: One who touches the dead body of any human being shall be unclean seven days.

12.text: He shall purify himself with it on the third day and on the seventh day, and then he shall be clean; but if he does not purify himself on the third day and on the seventh day, he shall not be clean.

13.text: Whoever touches a dead person, the body of a human being who has died, and does not purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of Jehovah; and that person shall be cut off from Israel. Because the water for impurity was not sprinkled upon him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is still on him.

14.text: This is the law when a man dies in a tent: Anyone who comes into the tent and everyone who is in the tent shall be unclean seven days.

15.text: And every open vessel, which has no covering tied down on it, is unclean.

16.text: And whoever in the open field touches one who has been slain with a sword or a dead body or a human bone or a grave shall be unclean seven days.

17.text: And for the unclean they shall take of the ashes of the burning of the sin offering, and running water shall be added to them in a vessel;

18.text: And a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent and on all the furnishings and on the persons who were there, or on the one who touched the bone or the one slain or the one who died or the grave.

19.text: And the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day, and on the seventh day he shall purify him. And he shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water and shall be clean in the evening.

20.text: But the man who shall be unclean and does not purify himself, that person shall be cut off from the midst of the congregation, because he has defiled the sanctuary of Jehovah; the water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean.

21.text: So it shall be a perpetual statute for them. And he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until evening.

22.text: And whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the person who touches it shall be unclean until evening.

1.text: Then the children of Israel, the whole assembly, came to the wilderness of Zin in the first month, and the people stayed at Kadesh; and Miriam died there and was buried there.

2.text: And there was no water for the assembly, and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.

3.text: And the people contended with Moses and spoke, saying, If only we had expired when our brothers expired before Jehovah!

4.text: Why then have you brought the congregation of Jehovah into this wilderness for us and our livestock to die there?

5.text: Why then did you bring us up out of Egypt, to bring us to this wretched place? It is not a place of grain or figs or vines or pomegranates, and there is not even water to drink.

6.text: And Moses and Aaron went from before the congregation to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and fell upon their faces, and the glory of Jehovah appeared to them.

7.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

8.text: Take the rod, and gather the assembly, you and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, so that it yields its water. Thus you shall bring forth water for them out of the rock and give the assembly and their livestock something to drink.

9.text: And Moses took the rod from before Jehovah, as He had commanded him.

10.text: And Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said to them, Listen now, you rebels: Shall we bring forth water for you out of this rock?

11.text: Then Moses lifted up his hand and struck the rock with his rod twice; and abundant water came forth, and the assembly and their livestock drank.

12.text: And Jehovah said to Moses and Aaron, Because you did not believe in Me, to sanctify Me in the sight of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.

13.text: These are the waters of Meribah, where the children of Israel contended with Jehovah, and He was sanctified among them.

14.text: Now Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom: Thus says your brother Israel, You know all the hardship that has befallen us;

15.text: How our fathers went down to Egypt, and we dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians ill-treated us and our fathers;

16.text: And when we cried to Jehovah, He heard our voice and sent an Angel and brought us forth out of Egypt; and now we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your border.

17.text: Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or through vineyard, nor will we drink water from any well; we will go along the King';s Highway, not turning aside to the right or to the left, until we pass through your territory.

18.text: But Edom said to him, You shall not pass through my territory, or else I will come out against you with the sword.

19.text: Then the children of Israel said to him, We will go up by the highway, and if I and my livestock drink some of your water, then I will pay its price. Allow me only this one thing, to pass through on foot.

20.text: However he said, You shall not pass through. And Edom came out against him with a large number of people and with a mighty hand.

21.text: So Edom refused to give Israel passage through his territory, and Israel turned away from him.

22.text: Now when they journeyed from Kadesh, the children of Israel, the whole assembly, came to Mount Hor.

23.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Aaron at Mount Hor, on the border of the land of Edom, saying,

24.text: Aaron shall be gathered to his people, for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against My word at the waters of Meribah.

25.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up Mount Hor;

26.text: And strip Aaron of his garments and put them upon Eleazar his son; so Aaron will be gathered to his people, and will die there.

27.text: So Moses did just as Jehovah had commanded, and they went up Mount Hor in the sight of the whole assembly.

28.text: And when Moses had stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son, Aaron died there on the top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.

29.text: And when the whole assembly saw that Aaron had expired, all the house of Israel wept for Aaron thirty days.

1.text: And when the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, he fought against Israel and took some of them captive.

2.text: And Israel made a vow to Jehovah and said, If You will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.

3.text: And Jehovah listened to the voice of Israel and delivered up the Canaanites, and they utterly destroyed them and their cities. Thus the name of the place was called Hormah.

4.text: Then they journeyed from Mount Hor by the way to the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom; and the people became impatient on the way.

5.text: And the people spoke against God and against Moses, Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no food and there is no water; and our soul loathes this light bread.

6.text: Then Jehovah sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people, so that many people of Israel died.

7.text: And the people came to Moses and said, We have sinned, because we have spoken against Jehovah and against you; pray to Jehovah, that He may take away the serpents from us. So Moses prayed for the people.

8.text: Then Jehovah said to Moses, Make a fiery serpent, and set it on a pole; and everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live.

9.text: And Moses made a bronze serpent and set it on the pole; and if a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked at the bronze serpent, he lived.

10.text: And the children of Israel journeyed and encamped at Oboth.

11.text: And they journeyed from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim in the wilderness which faces Moab toward the sunrise.

12.text: From there they journeyed and encamped in the valley of Zered.

13.text: From there they journeyed and encamped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the border of the Amorites; for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.

14.text: Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of Jehovah, Waheb in Suphah, / And the valleys of the Arnon,

15.text: And the slope of the valleys / That inclines toward the seat of Ar / And leans toward the border of Moab.

16.text: And from there they journeyed to Beer; that is the well where Jehovah said to Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.

17.text: Then Israel sang this song: Spring up, O well! Sing to it!

18.text: The well, which the leaders sank, Which the nobles of the people dug, / With the scepter, with their staffs.  And from the wilderness they journeyed to Mattanah;

19.text: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth;

20.text: And from Bamoth to the valley that is in the land of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looks down upon the desert.

21.text: And Israel sent messengers to Sihon the king of the Amorites, saying,

22.text: Let me pass through your land. We will not turn aside into field or into vineyard; we will not drink water from any well. We will go by the King';s Highway until we have passed through your territory.

23.text: But Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his territory. And Sihon gathered all his people together and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and he came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.

24.text: And Israel struck him with the edge of the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as the children of Ammon; for the border of the children of Ammon was strong.

25.text: And Israel took all these cities, and Israel settled in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon and in all her villages.

26.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land out of his hand, as far as the Arnon.

27.text: Therefore those who speak in proverbs say, Come to Heshbon; let it be built, / And let the city of Sihon be established.

28.text: For fire has gone forth from Heshbon, / A flame from the city of Sihon; / It has consumed Ar of Moab / And swallowed up the high places of the Arnon.

29.text: Woe to you, O Moab! / You have perished, O people of Chemosh; / He has given his sons as fugitives, / And his daughters have gone into captivity, / To an Amorite king, Sihon.

30.text: We have shot at them; / Heshbon is ruined as far as Dibon, / And we have laid waste as far as Nophah; / Fire spreads as far as Medeba.

31.text: Thus Israel settled in the land of the Amorites.

32.text: And Moses sent some to spy out Jazer. And they captured its villages and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.

33.text: And they turned and went up on the way that leads to Bashan; and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, for battle at Edrei.

34.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, Do not fear him, for I have given him and all his people and his land into your hand; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon the king of the Amorites, who was dwelling at Heshbon.

35.text: So they struck him and his sons and all his people until there was no survivor left to him, and they possessed his land.

1.text: And the children of Israel journeyed and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.

2.text: And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.

3.text: And Moab was very afraid of the people because they were many, and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.

4.text: And Moab said to the elders of Midian, This multitude will now lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field. Now Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.

5.text: And he sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, There is a people here who have come out from Egypt; now they cover the surface of the land and have settled over against me.

6.text: Now, therefore, please come; curse this people for me, since they are mightier than I. Perhaps I may be able to strike them and drive them out of the land, for I know that whomever you bless is blessed and whomever you curse is cursed.

7.text: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with fees for divination in their hand, and they came to Balaam and spoke to him the words of Balak.

8.text: And he said to them, Spend tonight here, and I will bring back word to you as Jehovah speaks to me. And the rulers of Moab stayed with Balaam.

9.text: And God came to Balaam and said, Who are these men with you?

10.text: And Balaam said to God, Balak the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, has sent word to me, saying,

11.text: There is a people who came out of Egypt, and they cover the surface of the land. Now come; curse them for me; perhaps I will be able to fight against them and drive them out.

12.text: And God said to Balaam, You shall not go with them; you shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.

13.text: So Balaam rose up in the morning and said to the rulers from Balak, Go to your land, for Jehovah has refused to let me go with you.

14.text: And the rulers of Moab rose up and went to Balak and said, Balaam refuses to come with us.

15.text: So Balak yet again sent rulers, more numerous and more honorable than these.

16.text: And they came to Balaam and said to him, Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me,

17.text: For I will indeed honor you greatly; and whatever you say to me I will do. Please come therefore; curse this people for me.

18.text: And Balaam answered and said to the servants of Balak, Even if Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the word of Jehovah my God, to do less or more.

19.text: Now you therefore please stay here tonight also, so that I may know what more Jehovah might speak to me.

20.text: And God came to Balaam at night and said to him, Since the men have come to call you, rise up; go with them, but only what I speak to you shall you do.

21.text: And Balaam rose up in the morning and saddled his donkey and went with the rulers of Moab.

22.text: And God';s anger was kindled because he was going, and the Angel of Jehovah took His stand in the way as an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.

23.text: And when the donkey saw the Angel of Jehovah standing in the way with His drawn sword in His hand, the donkey turned aside out of the way and went into the field. And Balaam struck the donkey to turn her back into the way.

24.text: Then the Angel of Jehovah stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, with a wall on this side and a wall on that side.

25.text: And when the donkey saw the Angel of Jehovah, she pressed herself against the wall and crushed Balaam';s foot against the wall. So he struck her again.

26.text: And the Angel of Jehovah went further and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right or to the left.

27.text: And when the donkey saw the Angel of Jehovah, she lay down under Balaam. Then Balaam';s anger was kindled, and he struck the donkey with his staff.

28.text: And Jehovah opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?

29.text: And Balaam said to the donkey, Because you have mocked me! If I had a sword in my hand, I would have killed you by now.

30.text: And the donkey said to Balaam, Am I not your donkey on which you have ridden all your life to this day? Have I ever been accustomed to do so to you? And he said, No.

31.text: Then Jehovah opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the Angel of Jehovah standing in the way with His drawn sword in His hand, and he bowed his head and fell on his face.

32.text: And the Angel of Jehovah said to him, Why have you struck your donkey these three times? I am here, having come out as an adversary, because your way was unrestrained before Me.

33.text: And the donkey saw Me and turned aside before Me these three times. If she had not turned aside from Me, I would surely have killed you just now and let her live.

34.text: And Balaam said to the Angel of Jehovah, I have sinned, for I did not know that You were standing in the way against me. Now then, if it displeases You, I will turn back.

35.text: And the Angel of Jehovah said to Balaam, Go with the men; but you shall speak only the word that I shall speak to you. So Balaam went with the rulers from Balak.

36.text: And when Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the city of Moab, which is on the border of the Arnon, at the farthest point of the border.

37.text: And Balak said to Balaam, Did I not send word urgently to you to call you? Why did you not come to me? Am I not indeed able to honor you?

38.text: And Balaam said to Balak, Here I am; I have come to you now. Am I able to speak anything at all? The word that God puts in my mouth, that I shall speak.

39.text: And Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.

40.text: And Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and sent them to Balaam and to the rulers who were with him.

41.text: And in the morning Balak took Balaam and brought him up to Bamoth-baal, and he saw from there the edge of the people.

1.text: Then Balaam said to Balak, Build me seven altars here, and have seven bulls and seven rams ready for me here.

2.text: And Balak did just as Balaam had spoken. And Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

3.text: And Balaam said to Balak, Stand near your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps Jehovah will come to meet me; and whatever He shows me I will tell you. And he went to a bare height.

4.text: And God met Balaam, and he said to Him, I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

5.text: And Jehovah put a word in Balaam';s mouth and said, Return to Balak, and you shall speak this.

6.text: When he returned to him, there he was, standing beside his burnt offering, he and all the rulers of Moab.

7.text: And he took up his parable and said, From Aram Balak brought me, / The king of Moab from the mountains of the East. / Come, curse Jacob for me; / And come, denounce Israel!

8.text: How shall I curse whom God has not cursed? / And how can I denounce whom Jehovah has not denounced?

9.text: For from the top of the rocks I see him, / And from the hills I behold him. / Here is a people who live alone / And do not reckon themselves among the nations.

10.text: Who can count the dust of Jacob, / Or number the fourth part of Israel? / Let me die the death of the upright, / And let my latter end be like theirs!

11.text: And Balak said to Balaam, What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, but now you have altogether blessed them.

12.text: And he answered and said, Shall I not take care to speak what Jehovah puts in my mouth?

13.text: And Balak said to him, Come now with me to another place from which you may see them. You will see only the outside edge of them and not see them all; then curse them for me from there.

14.text: So he took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

15.text: And he said to Balak, Stand here near your burnt offering while I meet Jehovah there.

16.text: And Jehovah met Balaam and put a word in his mouth and said, Return to Balak, and you shall speak this.

17.text: When he came to him, there he was, standing beside his burnt offering, and the rulers of Moab with him. And Balak said to him, What has Jehovah spoken?

18.text: And he took up his parable and said, Arise, O Balak, and hear; / Listen to me, O son of Zippor:

19.text: God is not a man, that He should lie, / Nor a son of man, that He should repent. / Has He said, and will He not do it? / Or has He spoken, and will He not establish it?

20.text: Now I have received a word to bless; / Since He has blessed, then I cannot reverse it.

21.text: He has not beheld iniquity in Jacob, / Nor has He seen trouble in Israel; / Jehovah their God is with them, / And the shout of a king is among them.

22.text: God is the One who brought them forth out of Egypt; / He has as it were the horns of the wild ox.

23.text: Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob, / Nor is there any divination against Israel. / Now it shall be said of Jacob / And of Israel, What God has wrought!

24.text: See, a people rises up like a lioness, / And like a lion they lift themselves up. / They shall not lie down until they eat the prey / And drink the blood of the slain.

25.text: And Balak said to Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.

26.text: But Balaam answered and said to Balak, Did I not tell you, saying, All that Jehovah speaks, that I must do?

27.text: And Balak said to Balaam, Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.

28.text: And Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which looks down upon the desert.

29.text: And Balaam said to Balak, Build me seven altars here, and have seven bulls and seven rams ready for me here.

30.text: And Balak did just as Balaam had said, and he offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

1.text: And when Balaam saw that it pleased Jehovah to bless Israel, he did not go as at the other times to meet with enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.

2.text: And Balaam lifted up his eyes and saw Israel dwelling according to their tribes, and the Spirit of God came upon him.

3.text: And he took up his parable and said, Balaam the son of Beor declares, / And the man whose eye is opened declares;

4.text: He declares, he who hears the words of God, / Who sees the vision of the All-sufficient One, / Falling down, but having his eyes uncovered:

5.text: How fair are your tents, O Jacob, / Your tabernacles, O Israel!

6.text: Like valleys they are spread forth, / Like gardens beside a river, / Like aloes which Jehovah has planted, / Like cedars beside water.

7.text: Water shall flow from his buckets, / And his seed shall be in many waters, / And his king shall be higher than Agag, / And his kingdom shall be exalted.

8.text: God is the One who brought him forth out of Egypt; / He has as it were the horns of the wild ox. / He shall eat up the nations, his adversaries, / And shall break their bones in pieces, / And shatter them with his arrows.

9.text: He couches; he lies down like a lion / And like a lioness; who will rouse him up? / Blessed is everyone who blesses you, / And cursed is everyone who curses you.

10.text: Then Balak';s anger was kindled against Balaam, and he struck his hands together. And Balak said to Balaam, I called you to curse my enemies, but now you have altogether blessed them these three times.

11.text: Therefore now flee to your place! I said I would greatly honor you, but now Jehovah has kept you away from honor.

12.text: And Balaam said to Balak, Did I not also speak to your messengers whom you sent to me, saying,

13.text: Even if Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the word of Jehovah, to do either good or bad from my own heart? What Jehovah speaks, that I will speak.

14.text: And now therefore, I am going to my people. Come, let me give you counsel as to what this people will do to your people in the last days.

15.text: And he took up his parable and said, Balaam the son of Beor declares, / And the man whose eye is opened declares;

16.text: He declares, he who hears the words of God / And obtains the knowledge of the Most High, / Who sees the vision of the All-sufficient One, / Falling down, but having his eyes uncovered:

17.text: I see Him, but not now; / I behold Him, but not near. / There shall come forth a Star out of Jacob, / And a Scepter shall rise out of Israel, / And He shall crush the corners of Moab / And break down all the sons of Sheth.

18.text: And Edom shall be dispossessed -- / Seir, His enemies, shall also be dispossessed -- / While Israel does valiantly.

19.text: And One from Jacob shall have dominion / And destroy the remnant from the city.

20.text: And he looked on Amalek and took up his parable and said, Amalek was the first of the nations, / But his latter end shall come to destruction.

21.text: And he looked on the Kenites and took up his parable and said, Strong is your dwelling place, / And your nest is set in the rock.

22.text: Nevertheless Kain shall be burned / Until Asshur carry you away captive.

23.text: And he took up his parable and said, / Alas, who shall live when God does this?

24.text: But ships shall come from the coast of Kittim, / And they shall afflict Asshur and shall afflict Eber; / And he also shall come to destruction.

25.text: And Balaam rose up and went back to his place, and Balak also went his way.

1.text: While Israel dwelt in Shittim, the people began to commit fornication with the daughters of Moab.

2.text: For they invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.

3.text: And Israel joined itself to Baal-peor, and the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel.

4.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, Take all the leaders of the people and hang them up to Jehovah before the sun, so that the fierce anger of Jehovah may turn away from Israel.

5.text: And Moses said to the judges of Israel, Each of you slay his men who have joined themselves to Baal-peor.

6.text: Just then one of the children of Israel came and brought a Midianite woman to his brothers in the sight of Moses and in the sight of the whole assembly of the children of Israel, while they were weeping at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

7.text: And when Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from the midst of the assembly and took a spear in his hand,

8.text: And he went after the man of Israel into the tent and pierced both of them, the man of Israel and the woman through her stomach. So the plague among the children of Israel was stopped.

9.text: And those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.

10.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

11.text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned My wrath away from the children of Israel, in that he was jealous with My jealousy among them, so that I did not consume the children of Israel in My jealousy.

12.text: Therefore say, I now give him My covenant of peace;

13.text: And it shall be to him and to his seed after him the covenant of an everlasting priesthood, because he was jealous for his God and made expiation for the children of Israel.

14.text: Now the name of the slain man of Israel, who was slain with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, a leader of a father';s household among the Simeonites.

15.text: And the name of the Midianite woman who was slain was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, head of the people of a father';s household in Midian.

16.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

17.text: Harass the Midianites and strike them;

18.text: For they have harassed you with their deception with which they have deceived you in the matter of Peor and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of the prince of Midian, their sister, who was slain on the day of the plague in the matter of Peor.

1.text: Now after the plague Jehovah spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,

2.text: Take the sum of the whole assembly of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers'; households, all who are able to go forth for military service in Israel.

3.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

4.text: Take the sum of the people, from twenty years old and upward, as Jehovah commanded Moses. Now the children of Israel, who came forth out of the land of Egypt were:

5.text: Reuben, the firstborn of Israel; the sons of Reuben: of Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the family of the Palluites;

6.text: Of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.

7.text: These are the families of the Reubenites, and those who were numbered of them were forty-three thousand seven hundred thirty.

8.text: And the sons of Pallu: Eliab.

9.text: And the sons of Eliab: Nemuel and Dathan and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram, who were called by the assembly, who contended against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against Jehovah;

10.text: And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, when the fire consumed two hundred fifty men; and they became a sign.

11.text: But the sons of Korah did not die.

12.text: The sons of Simeon according to their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites;

13.text: Of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.

14.text: These are the families of the Simeonites, twenty-two thousand two hundred.

15.text: The sons of Gad according to their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites;

16.text: Of Ozni, the family of the Oznites; of Eri, the family of the Erites;

17.text: Of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.

18.text: These are the families of the sons of Gad according to those who were numbered of them, forty thousand five hundred.

19.text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.

20.text: And the sons of Judah according to their families were: of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; of Perez, the family of the Perezites; of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites.

21.text: And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.

22.text: These are the families of Judah according to those who were numbered of them, seventy-six thousand five hundred.

23.text: The sons of Issachar according to their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the family of the Punites;

24.text: Of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.

25.text: These are the families of Issachar according to those who were numbered of them, sixty-four thousand three hundred.

26.text: The sons of Zebulun according to their families: of Sered, the family of the Seredites; of Elon, the family of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.

27.text: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those who were numbered of them, sixty thousand five hundred.

28.text: The sons of Joseph according to their families: Manasseh and Ephraim.

29.text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites; and Machir begat Gilead; of Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.

30.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the family of the Iezerites; of Helek, the family of the Helekites;

31.text: And of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;

32.text: And of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.

33.text: Now Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters, and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

34.text: These are the families of Manasseh; and those who were numbered of them were fifty-two thousand seven hundred.

35.text: These are the sons of Ephraim according to their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the family of the Becherites; of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.

36.text: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.

37.text: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those who were numbered of them, thirty-two thousand five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph according to their families.

38.text: The sons of Benjamin according to their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites;

39.text: Of Shephupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.

40.text: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites; of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.

41.text: These are the sons of Benjamin according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand six hundred.

42.text: These are the sons of Dan according to their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan according to their families.

43.text: All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those who were numbered of them, were sixty-four thousand four hundred.

44.text: The sons of Asher according to their families: of Imnah, the family of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the family of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the family of the Berites.

45.text: From the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.

46.text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.

47.text: These are the families of the sons of Asher according to those who were numbered of them, fifty-three thousand four hundred.

48.text: The sons of Naphtali according to their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the family of the Gunites;

49.text: Of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.

50.text: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand four hundred.

51.text: These are those who were numbered of the children of Israel, six hundred one thousand seven hundred thirty.

52.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

53.text: To these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.

54.text: You shall increase the larger group';s inheritance, and you shall reduce the smaller group';s inheritance. Each shall be given their inheritance according to those who were numbered of them.

55.text: But the land shall be apportioned by lot; they shall inherit it according to the names of the tribes of their fathers.

56.text: According to the lot their inheritance shall be apportioned among the larger and the smaller groups.

57.text: And these are those who were numbered of the Levites according to their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.

58.text: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. And Kohath begot Amram.

59.text: And the name of Amram';s wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; and she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.

60.text: And to Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

61.text: And Nadab and Abihu died when they offered strange fire before Jehovah.

62.text: And those who were numbered of them were twenty-three thousand, every male from a month old and upward, for they were not numbered among the children of Israel, because no inheritance was given to them among the children of Israel.

63.text: These are those who were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.

64.text: But among these there was not one of those numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest, who had numbered the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.

65.text: For Jehovah had said of them, They shall surely die in the wilderness. And not one of them was left, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.

1.text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph came near. And these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah and Tirzah.

2.text: And they stood before Moses and before Eleazar the priest and before the leaders and the whole assembly at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, saying,

3.text: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against Jehovah in the company of Korah; but he died in his own sin, and he had no sons.

4.text: Why should our father';s name be taken away from among his family because he had no son? Give us a possession among our father';s brothers.

5.text: And Moses brought their case before Jehovah.

6.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

7.text: The daughters of Zelophehad speak rightly. You shall surely give them the possession of an inheritance among their father';s brothers; and you shall cause the inheritance of their father to pass to them.

8.text: And you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, If a man dies and has no son, then you shall cause his inheritance to pass to his daughter.

9.text: And if he does not have a daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.

10.text: And if he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father';s brothers.

11.text: And if his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his relative nearest to him among his family, and he shall possess it. And it shall be a statute of judgment for the children of Israel, as Jehovah commanded Moses.

12.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, Go up to this mountain of the Abarim and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.

13.text: And when you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother was gathered,

14.text: Because you rebelled against My word in the wilderness of Zin, in the strife of the assembly, and failed to sanctify Me at the waters before their eyes. (These are the waters of Meribah-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin.)

15.text: And Moses spoke to Jehovah, saying,

16.text: Let Jehovah, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the assembly,

17.text: Who will go out before them and who will come in before them, and who will lead them out and who will bring them in; so that the assembly of Jehovah will not be like sheep which have no shepherd.

18.text: And Jehovah said to Moses, Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand upon him;

19.text: And set him before Eleazar the priest and before the whole assembly, and give him a charge in their sight.

20.text: And you shall put some of your honor upon him, so that the whole assembly of the children of Israel may obey him.

21.text: And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, and he shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before Jehovah. At his word shall they go out and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the children of Israel with him, even the whole assembly.

22.text: And Moses did as Jehovah commanded him, and he took Joshua and set him before Eleazar the priest and before the whole assembly.

23.text: And he laid his hands upon him and gave him a charge just as Jehovah had spoken through Moses.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Command the children of Israel and say to them, My offering, My food for My offerings by fire of a satisfying fragrance to Me, you shall be careful to present to Me at its appointed time.

3.text: And you shall say to them, This is the offering by fire which you shall present to Jehovah: two male lambs a year old without blemish each day as a continual burnt offering.

4.text: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight;

5.text: Also a tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mingled with the fourth of a hin of beaten oil.

6.text: It is a continual burnt offering, which was set up on Mount Sinai for a satisfying fragrance, an offering by fire to Jehovah.

7.text: And its drink offering shall be the fourth of a hin for the one lamb; in the sanctuary you shall pour out a drink offering of strong drink to Jehovah.

8.text: And the other lamb you shall offer at twilight; you shall offer it with the meal offering and its drink offering as in the morning, an offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah.

9.text: And on the Sabbath day two male lambs a year old without blemish, and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mingled with oil, and its drink offering --

10.text: This is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, besides the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.

11.text: And at the beginnings of your months you shall present a burnt offering to Jehovah: two bulls of the herd and one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;

12.text: And three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mingled with oil, for each bull; and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mingled with oil, for the one ram;

13.text: And a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal offering for each lamb for a burnt offering, a satisfying fragrance, an offering by fire to Jehovah.

14.text: And their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, and a third of a hin for the ram, and a fourth of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt offering of each month throughout the months of the year.

15.text: Also one male goat for a sin offering to Jehovah shall be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.

16.text: And in the first month on the fourteenth day of the month shall be Jehovah';s Passover.

17.text: And on the fifteenth day of this month shall be a feast; seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten.

18.text: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation; you shall do no work of labor;

19.text: But you shall present an offering by fire, a burnt offering to Jehovah: two bulls of the herd and one ram and seven male lambs a year old; they shall be without blemish for you;

20.text: And you shall offer their meal offering of fine flour mingled with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for a bull and two-tenths for a ram;

21.text: You shall offer one-tenth for each lamb of the seven lambs;

22.text: And one male goat as a sin offering, to make expiation for you.

23.text: You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.

24.text: In this way you shall offer daily, for seven days, the food of the offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah; it shall be offered besides the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.

25.text: And on the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no work of labor.

26.text: Also in the day of the firstfruits, when you present a new meal offering to Jehovah in your Feast of Weeks, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no work of labor;

27.text: But you shall present a burnt offering for a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah: two bulls of the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old;

28.text: And their meal offering of fine flour mingled with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, two-tenths for one ram,

29.text: One-tenth for each lamb of the seven lambs;

30.text: And one male goat, to make expiation for you.

31.text: Besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering, you shall offer them (they shall be without blemish for you) and their drink offerings.

1.text: Now in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no work of labor. It is a day of blowing of trumpets for you.

2.text: And you shall offer a burnt offering for a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah: one bull of the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;

3.text: And their meal offering of fine flour mingled with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths for the ram,

4.text: And one-tenth for each lamb of the seven lambs;

5.text: And one male goat as a sin offering, to make expiation for you;

6.text: Besides the burnt offering of the new moon and its meal offering, and the continual burnt offering and its meal offering, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, for a satisfying fragrance, an offering by fire to Jehovah.

7.text: And on the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation, and you shall afflict your souls; you shall not do any work.

8.text: And you shall present a burnt offering to Jehovah for a satisfying fragrance: one bull of the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old; they shall be without blemish for you;

9.text: And their meal offering of fine flour mingled with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths for the one ram,

10.text: One-tenth for each lamb of the seven lambs;

11.text: One male goat as a sin offering; besides the sin offering of expiation and the continual burnt offering and its meal offering, and their drink offerings.

12.text: And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no work of labor, and you shall hold a feast to Jehovah seven days.

13.text: And you shall present a burnt offering, an offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah: thirteen bulls of the herd, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old; they shall be without blemish;

14.text: And their meal offering of fine flour mingled with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each bull of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths of an ephah for each ram of the two rams,

15.text: And one-tenth of an ephah for each lamb of the fourteen lambs;

16.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

17.text: And on the second day: twelve bulls of the herd, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

18.text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;

19.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering, and their drink offerings.

20.text: And on the third day: eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

21.text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;

22.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering and its drink offering.

23.text: And on the fourth day: ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

24.text: Their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;

25.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

26.text: And on the fifth day: nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

27.text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;

28.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering and its drink offering.

29.text: And on the sixth day: eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

30.text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;

31.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offerings.

32.text: And on the seventh day: seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

33.text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;

34.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

35.text: On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly; you shall do no work of labor,

36.text: But you shall present a burnt offering, an offering by fire, a satisfying fragrance to Jehovah: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;

37.text: Their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs by their number according to the ordinance;

38.text: And one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering and its drink offering.

39.text: These you shall offer to Jehovah in your appointed feasts, besides your vows and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings and for your meal offerings and for your drink offerings and for your peace offerings.

40.text: And Moses spoke to the children of Israel according to all that Jehovah had commanded Moses.

1.text: And Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying, This is what Jehovah has commanded:

2.text: When a man vows a vow to Jehovah or swears an oath to bind himself by pledge, he shall not break his word; he shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.

3.text: But when a woman vows a vow to Jehovah or binds herself by pledge in her father';s house in her youth,

4.text: And her father hears of her vow or her pledge by which she has bound herself, and her father is silent with respect to her; then all her vows will stand, and any pledge by which she has bound herself will stand.

5.text: But if her father disallows her on the day he hears, none of her vows or of her pledges by which she has bound herself will stand; and Jehovah will forgive her because her father disallowed her.

6.text: And if she gets married, while her vows are upon her or the rash utterance of her lips by which she has bound herself,

7.text: And her husband hears of it and is silent with respect to her on the day he hears it, then her vows will stand and her pledges by which she has bound herself will stand.

8.text: But if, on the day her husband hears of it, he disallows her, then he makes void her vow which is upon her and the rash utterance of her lips by which she has bound herself; and Jehovah will forgive her.

9.text: But the vow of a widow or of a divorced woman, everything by which she has bound herself, will stand against her.

10.text: And if she vowed in her husband';s house or bound herself by a pledge with an oath,

11.text: And her husband heard of it and was silent with respect to her and did not disallow her, then all her vows will stand and any pledge by which she has bound herself will stand.

12.text: But if her husband made them null and void on the day he heard of it, then whatever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows or concerning the pledging of herself will not stand; her husband has made them void, and Jehovah will forgive her.

13.text: As for every vow and every binding oath to afflict herself, her husband may establish it or her husband may make it void.

14.text: But if her husband is completely silent with respect to her from day to day, then he establishes all her vows or all her pledges which are upon her; he has established them because he was silent with respect to her on the day he heard it.

15.text: But if he makes them null and void some time after he has heard of it, then he shall bear her iniquity.

16.text: These are the statutes which Jehovah commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, and between a father and his daughter while in her youth in her father';s house.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Thoroughly avenge the children of Israel on the Midianites; afterward you will be gathered to your people.

3.text: And Moses spoke to the people, saying, Arm men from among you for the war, that they may come upon Midian to execute Jehovah';s vengeance on Midian.

4.text: A thousand from each tribe, of all the tribes of Israel, you shall send to the war.

5.text: So out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand for each tribe were committed, twelve thousand armed for war.

6.text: And Moses sent them, a thousand for each tribe, to the war, and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest with them, to the war, with the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.

7.text: And they warred against Midian, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses; and they killed every male.

8.text: And they killed the kings of Midian in addition to the others slain among them: Evi and Rekem and Zur and Hur and Reba, the five kings of Midian; also Balaam the son of Beor they slew with the sword.

9.text: And the children of Israel took captive the women of Midian and their little ones, and all their cattle and all their livestock and all their goods they plundered.

10.text: And all their cities in which they had settled and all their encampments, they burned with fire.

11.text: And they took all the spoil and all the booty, both of man and of beast.

12.text: And they brought the captives and the booty and the spoil to Moses and to Eleazar the priest and to the assembly of the children of Israel, to the camp in the plains of Moab, which was beside the Jordan at Jericho.

13.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the assembly went out to meet them outside the camp.

14.text: And Moses became angry with the officers of the company, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who came from service in the war.

15.text: And Moses said to them, Have you kept all the women alive?

16.text: It was these who caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to act unfaithfully against Jehovah in the matter of Peor, so that the plague came upon the assembly of Jehovah.

17.text: Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known a man by lying with him.

18.text: But all the little ones among the women, who have not known a male by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.

19.text: And you, encamp outside the camp seven days, everyone who has killed any person and everyone who has touched any slain; purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, you and your captives.

20.text: And you shall purify for yourselves every garment and every article of skin and everything made of goats'; hair and every article of wood.

21.text: And Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who had gone to the battle, This is the statute of the law which Jehovah has commanded Moses:

22.text: Only the gold and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,

23.text: Everything that can go into the fire, you shall pass through the fire, and it will become clean; but it shall be purified with the water for impurity; and everything that cannot go into the fire you shall pass through the water.

24.text: And you shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean; and afterward you may come into the camp.

25.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

26.text: You and Eleazar the priest and the heads of the fathers'; households of the assembly, take the sum of the booty that was captured, both of man and of beast,

27.text: And halve the booty between those skilled in war who went out to battle and the whole assembly.

28.text: And levy a tribute to Jehovah from the men of war who went out to battle: one living thing out of five hundred, of the persons and of the cattle and of the donkeys and of the flock;

29.text: Take it from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest, for Jehovah';s heave offering.

30.text: And of the children of Israel';s half, you shall take one seized out of fifty, of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, from all the beasts, and give them to the Levites, who keep the charge of the tabernacle of Jehovah.

31.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest did just as Jehovah commanded Moses.

32.text: Now the booty that was left from the spoil, which the men of war had taken, was six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,

35.text: And thirty-two thousand persons in all, the women who had not known lying with a male.

36.text: And the half which was the portion of those who went out to war was in number three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep.

37.text: And Jehovah';s tribute of the sheep was six hundred seventy-five.

38.text: And the cattle were thirty-six thousand, of which Jehovah';s tribute was seventy-two.

39.text: And the donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which Jehovah';s tribute was sixty-one.

40.text: And the human beings were sixteen thousand, of whom Jehovah';s tribute was thirty-two persons.

41.text: And Moses gave the tribute, Jehovah';s heave offering, to Eleazar the priest, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

42.text: And of the children of Israel';s half, which Moses had separated from the men who had gone to war,

43.text: That is, the assembly';s half, was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,

45.text: And thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,

47.text: Now Moses took from the children of Israel';s half, one drawn out of every fifty, both of man and of beast, and gave them to the Levites, who kept the charge of the tabernacle of Jehovah, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

48.text: And the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, approached Moses.

49.text: And they said to Moses, Your servants have taken the sum of the men of war who are under our charge, and not a man is missing from us;

50.text: And we have presented Jehovah';s offering, what every man has obtained, articles of gold, armlets and bracelets, signet rings, earrings and pendants, to make expiation for our souls before Jehovah.

51.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, all kinds of wrought articles.

52.text: And all the gold of the heave offering which they offered up to Jehovah, from the captains of thousands and from the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred fifty shekels.

53.text: The men of war had taken booty, each for himself.

54.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the Tent of Meeting as a memorial for the children of Israel before Jehovah.

1.text: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great abundance of livestock. And when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, that the place was indeed a place for livestock,

2.text: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the priest and to the leaders of the assembly, saying,

3.text: Ataroth and Dibon and Jazer and Nimrah and Heshbon and Elealeh and Sebam and Nebo and Beon,

4.text: The land which Jehovah struck before the assembly of Israel, is a land for livestock, and your servants have livestock.

5.text: And they said, If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession; do not make us cross over the Jordan.

6.text: And Moses said to the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben, Shall your brothers go to war, while you stay here?

7.text: Now why would you discourage the heart of the children of Israel from crossing over into the land which Jehovah has given them?

8.text: Your fathers did this when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.

9.text: When they went up to the valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel from going into the land which Jehovah had given them.

10.text: And Jehovah';s anger was kindled in that day, and He swore, saying,

11.text: Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, because they have not fully followed Me;

12.text: Except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua the son of Nun, because they have fully followed Jehovah.

13.text: And Jehovah';s anger was kindled against Israel, and He made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until the whole generation which had done evil in the sight of Jehovah was consumed.

14.text: And now you have risen up in your fathers'; place, a brood of sinful men, to further increase the burning anger of Jehovah toward Israel.

15.text: For if you turn away from following Him, He will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and you will destroy this entire people.

16.text: And they came near to him and said, We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock and cities for our little ones;

17.text: But we ourselves will be armed and ready to go before the children of Israel until we have brought them to their place, while our little ones dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.

18.text: We will not return to our houses until each one of the children of Israel has inherited his inheritance.

19.text: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and further on, because our inheritance has come to us on this side of the Jordan eastward.

20.text: And Moses said to them, If you will do this thing, if you will arm yourselves before Jehovah for battle,

21.text: And all of your armed men will cross over the Jordan before Jehovah until He has driven out His enemies from before Him,

22.text: And the land is subdued before Jehovah, then afterward you shall return and be free of obligation toward Jehovah and toward Israel; and this land shall be yours for a possession before Jehovah.

23.text: But if you will not do so, then you have sinned against Jehovah; and know that your sin will find you out.

24.text: Build for yourselves cities for your little ones and folds for your sheep, and do what has proceeded out of your mouth.

25.text: And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying, Your servants will do as my lord commands.

26.text: Our little ones, our wives, our livestock, and all our cattle will be there in the cities of Gilead;

27.text: But your servants will cross over, everyone who is armed for war before Jehovah for battle, as my lord says.

28.text: So Moses gave command concerning them to Eleazar the priest and to Joshua the son of Nun and to the heads of the fathers'; houses of the tribes of the children of Israel.

29.text: And Moses said to them, If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben cross over the Jordan with you, everyone who is armed for battle before Jehovah, and the land is subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead as a possession.

30.text: But if they do not cross over armed with you, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.

31.text: And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, As Jehovah has said to your servants, so will we do.

32.text: We will cross over armed before Jehovah into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance will remain with us beyond the Jordan.

33.text: And Moses gave to them, to the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon the king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og the king of Bashan, the land according to its cities with their territories, the cities of the surrounding land.

34.text: And the children of Gad built Dibon and Ataroth and Aroer

35.text: And Atroth-shophan and Jazer and Jogbehah

36.text: And Beth-nimrah and Beth-haran as fortified cities, and folds for sheep.

37.text: And the children of Reuben built Heshbon and Elealeh and Kiriathaim

38.text: And Nebo and Baal-meon -- their names being changed -- and Sibmah, and they gave other names to the cities which they built.

39.text: And the children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead and took it and dispossessed the Amorites who were in it.

40.text: And Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh, and he dwelt in it.

41.text: And Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its villages and called them Havvoth-jair.

42.text: And Nobah went and took Kenath and its towns, and called it Nobah after his own name.

1.text: These are the journeys of the children of Israel, when they went forth out of the land of Egypt by their companies under the direction of Moses and Aaron.

2.text: And Moses wrote down the places that they went out from for their journeys according to the commandment of Jehovah; and these are their journeys according to the places they went out from.

3.text: Now they journeyed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month. On the day after the passover the children of Israel went out boldly in the sight of all the Egyptians,

4.text: While the Egyptians were burying those whom Jehovah had struck down among them, all their firstborn; on their gods Jehovah also executed judgments.

5.text: And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses and encamped at Succoth.

6.text: And they journeyed from Succoth and encamped at Etham, which is at the edge of the wilderness.

7.text: And they journeyed from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, which faces Baal-zephon; and they encamped before Migdol.

8.text: And they journeyed from Pi-hahiroth and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, and they went three days'; journey in the wilderness of Etham and encamped at Marah.

9.text: And they journeyed from Marah and came to Elim. And in Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they encamped there.

10.text: And they journeyed from Elim and encamped by the Red Sea.

11.text: And they journeyed from the Red Sea and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.

12.text: And they journeyed from the wilderness of Sin and encamped at Dophkah.

13.text: And they journeyed from Dophkah and encamped at Alush.

14.text: And they journeyed from Alush and encamped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink there.

15.text: And they journeyed from Rephidim and encamped in the wilderness of Sinai.

16.text: And they journeyed from the wilderness of Sinai and encamped at Kibroth-hattaavah.

17.text: And they journeyed from Kibroth-hattaavah and encamped at Hazeroth.

18.text: And they journeyed from Hazeroth and encamped at Rithmah.

19.text: And they journeyed from Rithmah and encamped at Rimmon-perez.

20.text: And they journeyed from Rimmon-perez and encamped at Libnah.

21.text: And they journeyed from Libnah and encamped at Rissah.
