22.text: And they journeyed from Rissah and encamped at Kehelathah.

23.text: And they journeyed from Kehelathah and encamped at Mount Shepher.

24.text: And they journeyed from Mount Shepher and encamped at Haradah.

25.text: And they journeyed from Haradah and encamped at Makheloth.

26.text: And they journeyed from Makheloth and encamped at Tahath.

27.text: And they journeyed from Tahath and encamped at Terah.

28.text: And they journeyed from Terah and encamped at Mithkah.

29.text: And they journeyed from Mithkah and encamped at Hashmonah.

30.text: And they journeyed from Hashmonah and encamped at Moseroth.

31.text: And they journeyed from Moseroth and encamped at Bene-jaakan.

32.text: And they journeyed from Bene-jaakan and encamped at Hor-haggidgad.

33.text: And they journeyed from Hor-haggidgad and encamped at Jotbathah.

34.text: And they journeyed from Jotbathah and encamped at Abronah.

35.text: And they journeyed from Abronah and encamped at Ezion-geber.

36.text: And they journeyed from Ezion-geber and encamped in the wilderness of Zin, that is, Kadesh.

37.text: And they journeyed from Kadesh and encamped in Mount Hor at the edge of the land of Edom.

38.text: And Aaron the priest went up onto Mount Hor at the commandment of Jehovah and died there in the fortieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month, on the first day of the month.

39.text: And Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.

40.text: And the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who was dwelling in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.

41.text: And they journeyed from Mount Hor and encamped at Zalmonah.

42.text: And they journeyed from Zalmonah and encamped at Punon.

43.text: And they journeyed from Punon and encamped at Oboth.

44.text: And they journeyed from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim on the border of Moab.

45.text: And they journeyed from Iyim and encamped at Dibon-gad.

46.text: And they journeyed from Dibon-gad and encamped in Almon-diblathaim.

47.text: And they journeyed from Almon-diblathaim and encamped in the mountains of the Abarim before Nebo.

48.text: And they journeyed from the mountains of the Abarim and encamped in the plains of Moab beside the Jordan at Jericho.

49.text: And they encamped beside the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.

50.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

51.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

52.text: You shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, and you shall destroy all their figured stones and destroy all their molten images and demolish all their high places;

53.text: And you shall take possession of the land and dwell in it, for to you I have given the land to possess it.

54.text: And you shall inherit the land by lot according to your families; to the larger you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller you shall give a smaller inheritance. Wherever the lot falls to anyone, that shall be his. You shall inherit according to the tribes of your fathers.

55.text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those whom you let remain of them will become as splinters in your eyes and as thorns in your sides, and they will trouble you in the land in which you are dwelling.

56.text: And just as I thought to do to them, so will I do to you.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Command the children of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall to you for an inheritance, the land of Canaan according to its borders.

3.text: And your southern section shall be from the wilderness of Zin along the side of Edom, and your southern border shall begin from the end of the Salt Sea on the east.

4.text: And your border shall turn about south to the ascent of Akrabbim and pass on to Zin, and it shall go out to the south of Kadesh-barnea, even going out to Hazar-addar; then it shall pass on to Azmon.

5.text: Then the border shall turn from Azmon to the brook of Egypt, and it shall go out to the sea.

6.text: And for the western border you shall have the Great Sea and its coast; this shall be your western border.

7.text: And this shall be your northern border: From the Great Sea you shall mark out a line for yourselves to Mount Hor.

8.text: From Mount Hor you shall mark out a line to the entrance of Hamath; and the border shall go out to Zedad;

9.text: And the border shall go out to Ziphron, and it shall go out to Hazar-enan. This shall be your northern border.

10.text: And you shall mark out your eastern border from Hazar-enan to Shepham;

11.text: And the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain; and the border shall go down and reach the slope on the east of the Sea of Chinnereth;

12.text: And the border shall go down to the Jordan, and it shall go out to the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to its borders all around.

13.text: And Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which Jehovah has commanded to give to the nine tribes and to the half-tribe.

14.text: For the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their fathers'; households and the tribe of the children of Gad according to their fathers'; households and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.

15.text: The two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.

16.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

17.text: These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.

18.text: And you shall take one leader from each tribe to divide the land for inheritance.

19.text: And these are the names of the men: For the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

20.text: And for the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.

21.text: For the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.

22.text: And for the tribe of the children of Dan, a leader, Bukki the son of Jogli.

23.text: For the children of Joseph: For the tribe of the children of Manasseh, a leader, Hanniel the son of Ephod.

24.text: And for the tribe of the children of Ephraim, a leader, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.

25.text: And for the tribe of the children of Zebulun, a leader, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.

26.text: And for the tribe of the children of Issachar, a leader, Paltiel the son of Azzan.

27.text: And for the tribe of the children of Asher, a leader, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.

28.text: And for the tribe of the children of Naphtali, a leader, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.

29.text: These are those whom Jehovah commanded to divide the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.

1.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

2.text: Command the children of Israel to give to the Levites some of the inheritance of their possession, cities to dwell in; and you shall give to the Levites pasture lands around their cities.

3.text: And the cities shall be for them to dwell in, and their pasture lands shall be for their cattle and for their livestock and for all their animals.

4.text: And the pasture lands of the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be from the city wall and outward, a thousand cubits all around.

5.text: And you shall measure from the outside of the city on the east side two thousand cubits and on the south side two thousand cubits and on the west side two thousand cubits and on the north side two thousand cubits, with the city in the center. This shall be their pasture lands for the cities.

6.text: And the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the manslayer to flee to; and besides them you shall give forty-two cities.

7.text: All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities, they and their pasture lands.

8.text: And concerning the cities which you shall give from the possession of the children of Israel, from the larger tribe you shall take a larger number, and from the smaller tribe you shall take a smaller number; each one, according to its inheritance which they will inherit, shall give some of its cities to the Levites.

9.text: Then Jehovah spoke to Moses, saying,

10.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

11.text: Then you shall designate for yourselves cities to be your cities of refuge, so that the manslayer who kills any person unintentionally may flee there.

12.text: And the cities shall be for you as a refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer may not die unless he stands before the assembly for judgment.

13.text: And the cities which you shall give shall be your six cities of refuge.

14.text: You shall give three cities across the Jordan, and you shall give three cities in the land of Canaan; they shall be cities of refuge.

15.text: For the children of Israel and for the stranger and for the sojourner among them, these six cities shall be for refuge, so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there.

16.text: But if he struck him with an instrument of iron, and he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.

17.text: And if he struck him with a stone in hand, by which one could die, and he did die, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.

18.text: Or if he struck him with a wooden object in hand, by which one could die, and he did die, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.

19.text: The avenger of blood himself shall put the murderer to death; when he encounters him, he shall put him to death.

20.text: And if he pushed him out of hatred or threw something upon him while lying in wait, and he died,

21.text: Or in enmity struck him with his hand, and he died, the one who struck him shall surely be put to death; he is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he encounters him.

22.text: But if he pushed him suddenly without enmity, or threw upon him anything without lying in wait,

23.text: Or came upon him with any stone, by which someone could die, without seeing him and dropped it upon him, and he died, when he was not his enemy and did not seek his harm,

24.text: Then the assembly shall judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances.

25.text: And the assembly shall deliver the manslayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the assembly shall return him to his city of refuge to which he had fled; and he shall dwell in it until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.

26.text: But if the manslayer shall at any time go beyond the boundary of his city of refuge to which he has fled,

27.text: And the avenger of blood finds him outside the boundary of his city of refuge and the avenger of blood slays the manslayer, he shall not have guilt for blood,

28.text: Because he should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest; but after the death of the high priest the manslayer shall return to the land of his possession.

29.text: And these things shall be for a statute of judgment to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

30.text: Whoever kills a person, the murderer shall be slain upon the testimony of witnesses; but one witness shall not testify against any person so that he die.

31.text: Moreover you shall not take a ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, but he shall surely be put to death.

32.text: And you shall not take a ransom for one who has fled to his city of refuge, so that he may return to live in the land before the death of the high priest.

33.text: Thus you shall not pollute the land in which you are, for blood pollutes the land. And no expiation can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, except by the blood of the one who shed it.

34.text: And you shall not defile the land in which you are dwelling, in the midst of which I tabernacle; for I Jehovah tabernacle in the midst of the children of Israel.

1.text: And the heads of the fathers'; households of the family of the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the leaders, the heads of the fathers'; households of the children of Israel;

2.text: And they said, Jehovah commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the children of Israel, and my lord was commanded by Jehovah to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.

3.text: But if they are married to one of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they belong; so it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.

4.text: And when the jubilee of the children of Israel takes place, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they belong; so their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.

5.text: Then Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of Jehovah, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph speaks correctly.

6.text: This is what Jehovah commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them be married to whom they think best; only into the family of the tribe of their father they shall marry.

7.text: So an inheritance of the children of Israel shall not go around from tribe to tribe, for each one of the children of Israel shall cling to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

8.text: And every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel shall marry into one of the family of the tribe of her father, so that each one of the children of Israel may possess the inheritance of his fathers.

9.text: So an inheritance shall not go around from one tribe to another tribe, for each one of the tribes of the children of Israel shall cling to his own inheritance.

10.text: Just as Jehovah had commanded Moses, so the daughters of Zelophehad did;

11.text: That is, Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to their uncles'; sons.

12.text: They married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.

13.text: These are the commandments and the ordinances which Jehovah commanded through Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
